aV74mcDnUI12lo2rXB89ww.text: I think this is the best restaurant in Charlotte. Think of it as a seafood restaurant and raw bar plus imaginative sushi. You can either sit at formal tables or at high tops in the bar area. I've done both but this time we were in the formal dining room. Their signature dish is sake marinated Chilean sea bass and as always it didn't disappoint. I had a steamed lobster, very nice we also had sushi bento box, salmon sashimi and calamari. Well enough about the food, the service was great, informative, friendly and efficient. If you are in Charlotte have a fair bit of credit on your credit card I recommend trying this fine restaurant.

88AR9zDwtLJi1QSND1C_Aw.text: Upstream is tres chic! I've been there multiple times and service has always been impeccable. What else would you expect from an establishment that has linen tablecloths?   My favorite times to go to Upstream has been for brunch and Thanksgiving . Their brunch is a tad on the high side ($25 I believe) but completely worth it just for a bite of the Brioche French Toast alone.  Along with that I've gone there for Thanksgiving dinner twice and was nothing but pleased with it. They have a complete traditional Thanksgiving spread set up in their bar along with sushi, cooked seafood and other goodies.   At the risk of sounding like George Costanza, they have one of the nicest restrooms I've seen in Charlotte. They also have a cute patio area with cushioned seats that's perfect to enjoy an after work cocktail on and watch the people of Phillips Place. And dare I say, even though it's in the heart of South Park-not an obnoxious number of misbehaved children . To top it all off, they are a part of Harpers restaurant group and offer cooking classes on Saturdays for $35/class (a few of the classes go for $55 or $60)

wc-td7tCliQLRpE_cJgpJA.text: 5-STAR Brunch!! We've taken all our out of town guests here, and they've loved it. Worth the $30pp.  Came here for happy hour bar bites, which was okay.   Never been here for dinner.

GGZosl72mVr20EopFH0CCQ.text: My girl and I came here for their Sunday brunch to enjoy the seafood and hang out with new friends.  While the decor of the restaurant and the service was quite good, it's in the food category where this place was severely lacking.  The way they do their brunch is buffet style with an assortment of stations which are self serve and two manned stations, one for carving and another for omelets.  Pretty standard setup.  Along with the buffet they had unlimited tapas that could be ordered for the table.  Meeting our friends there for a Sunday bite was nice.  The table was comfortable, the atmosphere up scale and everyone was generally pleasant.  That's the only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars.  The buffet suffered from the one cardinal sin of any buffet type offering, the food was left out too long.  Congealed mac & cheese, sushi with crunchy rice and sausage that had been dried out from being exposed for so long.  On top of that, none of the shrimp had been cleaned.  Not the large cold shrimp with cocktail sauce or the small shrimp tossed into the omelets.  That's beyond gross and completely unacceptable for a seafood restaurant of that caliber.  Honestly, I'd rather do the brunch at the Ballantyne Resort.  This place was not worth the money and with such a poor showing I won't even try them for dinner.

no9pv1LHqc3pd-WkZKKqHg.text: Never disappoints, the service, the appetizers , the sea bass is my favorite, my wife gets the crusted tuna, everything top notch. They take of you

gvJO1r__fuUK6YfL8gaJCA.text: Oh upstream how I love thee. Why am I writing yet another update with the same rating as the ones before you ask? So I can tell you about the brunch of course. This brunch is a monster of a buffet and tapas menu combined all for the low price of $25! Hold on you might be balking at the hefty sticker tag on this brunch but let me tell you about all the stuff you can well...stuff yourself with and you'll be singing praises too after you try this joint out.  This being one of my last weekends in Charlotte the boyfriend and I went with a yelpy crew consisting of Travis W., Melissa B., Chad E., And Denise. First off you walk in get greeted and led to your table and handed a nice tapas menu. They could've charged $7-10 for most of the items on this tapas menu and made a killing but nope they're giving it to you as part of the buffet, score! I tried the scallop risotto, crab benedict, belgian waffle, and some other things all excellent! But wait it doesn't stop there you walk into the bar area and BAM! you're hit with a massive buffet of brunch items. You want some smoked salmon and mushrooms folded into your freshly made omelet? No problem. Add some excellently carved prime rib onto that you got some good eats. I was so full before I even got halfway through working on this buffet.  This place has met my expectations for lunch, dinner, and now brunch. Hopefully I am back in Charlotte soon to give it another whirl. Though dinner is a bit expensive and they do need to tell you the prices of the specials lest you order a $45 bento box like I did, the staff is incredibly accomodating and attentive to your needs. Hell they even remembered my name and how I like my tea for lunch after the second time I was there! Give it a try, you can thank me later.

shpt2jXmzOPBHP2oI-LGHg.text: One of the top seafood spot that I have been to. The service was only there for 3 weeks and you would have never known. She new the menu and was on point.

FklpL7EafZHsHTejvDA21g.text: One of the best seafood restaurants I've ever been to! We ordered oysters, which were great, scallops the best and the monk fish was good too. Creme brule was a little too sweet but still tasted good.   Our waiter, George, was amazing, and he was also great with our kids (2.5 & 4.5 yrs old)!  I would highly recommend this place to friends and family! Great place!!

AARR0KMxXekYITRIYPyX6g.text: Great food! Great service! Our waiter was Christopher, and he was fantastic! He recommended excellent entrees, apps and wine that exceeded our expectations. We recently moved to Charlotte from NYC, and this is by far the best restaurant we've dined so far. The sea bass is almost as good as NOBU and the tuna... OMG!! Your mouth will love you, trust me. Enjoy .

Wy0Uk9KVPVC8zWV7_TqK-w.text: I wanted to love this place.   I've heard many good things about it but hadn't been here for years.   Some of the  service staff was a little too talkative.   I ordered the salmon salad because I was told by my server it was 1 of the 2 most popular entrees on the luncheon menu.   Although the presentation was beautiful, it definitely wasn't that spectacular.  Also, there weren't many people there for a Friday lunch and I'm wondering if I'm not the only one with a critical opinion.  Having said this, my friends really enjoyed their lunches so I am willing to give it another try when the opportunity presents itself.

4cxd1jF5AXeMKdf0-l3Jzg.text: WOW!  I had heard the brunch here was the best in Charlotte but was pretty doubtful.  We went this past Sunday and it was literally the best brunch ever - not just in Charlotte!!    The restaurant is pretty fancy so wear something nice.  For Sunday's brunch they have a tapas menu with great fresh options IN ADDITION TO the biggest brunch buffet you have ever seen.  The tapas we had were scallop risotto (oh - so THIS is what it is supposed to taste like!!!), Belgian waffles, and the crab-cake.  All of these are complimentary with the buffet so get them all!    All of it was so good - but then you have to go to the buffet.  I was so overwhelmed!!!    Buffet:  Pastries galore, fresh fruit, cheese, grilled chilled veggies, salmon wraps, red skin potato salad with bacon dressing, deli meats, omelet bar, shrimp and grits, baked salmon, roast beef, baked ziti, broccoli and cheese, fried chicken, ribs, sushi, shrimp, clams, oysters, mousse, tarts, bread pudding i - that is all i can remember.  They had to roll us out of there.    Yes it costs $25 bucks but it is WORTH EVERY PENNY.  The food was so fresh and delicious!!!  Mimosas and other cocktails (must wait till noon!) were $5 and the perfect complement.  Can't wait to go back!  It is fantastic!

SZ-tuI9FVlLtQaUkhrhmdA.text: Food, good. Bar area, so comforting and chill.  Place - I would never have thought it was so cozy, and upscale -- from the outside. I should have known better. I adore the look before the renovations. I have to come back and see what they have done to the new bar.  I just love the atmosphere here.  Food - their selection of food are fresh and delicious.  My husband and I came here for his birthday. He ordered the steak and he loved it. I ordered the mussels which were great and crab cakes that was outstanding. The one thing that got us to come back, was the Costa Rican chocolate that was amazingly decadent. We were told that they have an in house French pastry background chef that makes this. Superb!  So, we would come back here, this time, to the bar to enjoy the chocolate dessert and some fresh earl grey tea (no tea bags found here!).  We came back here again with different friends, had the sushi, which is good.   Service - we forgot our waiter's name, it's been so long.. But he was awesome and took care of us! The service by the bar was great also. Service outside the venue, out on the patio like area was good. My friends and I spent a good amount of time, eating sushi, and enjoying our desserts. Wine selection was great!  Just wished for a little more lighting outside. Just a bit more, underneath the umbrellas.

6kAHwd-Vz4BMcFqlQhDbgg.text: Very small portions for the prices.  My sea bass was less than 3 ounces!  Desserts need a lot of improvement.  Chocolate creme brulee was nothing but average chocolate pudding with a tiny bit of caramelized topping.  The pineapple upside down cake was noting but a subpar muffin.

ti7wO8A_zZh2a8FzPmXkrg.text: Absolutely love this place, perfect for Dinner and a Movie. It's located in the Phillips Place plaza which has trendy shops and a movie theater.   The bar or outside seating is perfect for a relaxing evening to enjoy some people watching. Dining room seating usually tends to take longer and the servers aren't as attentive, definitely not good for a quick lunch.   Appetizers to try are; the cheese plate, Sweet & Sour Calamari (my fav) and their Mussel Pot. They have a great sushi selection, I normally have their Spider and Firecracker Roll which is always fresh and perfect. I recently tried their Queen City Roll and its absolutely delicious paired with a glass of Conundrum. The mashed potatoes and baby green beans are a great side dish for any of their menu items. Also, try their bread pudding dessert when they have it on the menu, it's the best in town.

nE2VE2GHKfzfvoIHWszTkw.text: Great brunch! I'm looking forward to going back for dinner at some point in the near future. We made a reservation for 11:45am because I'd read that the wait can be long. When we arrived, there were plenty of open tables and no one waiting. We were seated right away...and then waited for at least 5 minutes with servers constantly walking by before anyone stopped to take our drink order. Then, after the first server came by and explained the concept, four or five servers came over and tried to do the same. This was really the only misstep for us.   We ordered several items off the brunch tapas menu - egg benedict, steak & egg, waffle, pecan crusted trout, and the french toast. They were all good. Then we made our way to the buffet area. The highlights for me where the shrimp and grits, macaroni & cheese, cod, sushi, fruit/cheese, and mussels & clams. Not as great were the peel & eat shrimp (which were slightly hard, but that may have been from sitting on ice for awhile.) I wasn't wild about the cocktail sauce, which had a definite orange taste to it. Also, the salmon from the carving station was just okay.  I'm a Bloody Mary enthusiast and Upstream's was not my favorite. It was by no means undrinkable, but the mix lacked the seasoning and toppings/snacks that make a great Bloody Mary.  The dessert bar offered a great variety of dessert bites - my favorites were the marshmallow/smore on a stick, lemon square, and the pecan tart.  All in all we'll go again, skip the Bloody Mary and focus just on the highlights. I'm also excited to try their dinner and Happy Hour Bar Bites menu.

SmQqgmzIQVJqwONZj9d0EQ.text: I must say I love the brunch buffet at Upstream much better than what they offer for  dinner.  I mean I would have to say it's probably the best brunch I've had in the queen city.  I'm not sure if they switch it up weekly but on my visit they had a spread of salads, steamed shrimp and clams, chicken, brisket, salmon, roast, an omelet station, shrimp and grits, pastas, a tapas menu(included in the price) with waffles, scallop risotto, trout tacos, crab cake benedict, french toast, etc., and an array of desserts........well worth the $25 bucks in my opinion.  The service was very impressive and they really catered to my busy 5 year old(major brownie points).  Everything was superb or was I dreaming?  I think that experience may require multiple Sunday visits.......

vaox8YHxkQfJrIVA_KBf9A.text: Upstream is just ok. Maybe I got the wrong thing. I ordered sushi, which had absolutely no flavor at all. I can't remember the name of it but it had shrimp, cucumbers and something else. I'm no sushi expert, but something was lacking. I enjoyed the open kitchen and our waitress was very nice. Other menu items looked good. Brunch may be my next choice for a visit to Upstream.

goVe_EDtSzVeolKD9tQwHQ.text: So, I've always longed to go to Upstream, but it's definitely out of my price range. Much to my excitement, I won a gift card in a charity fundraiser at work that allowed me to pay them a visit and taste what I might be missing.  My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday evening at 5:30. We figured we'd miss the crowds that way, and sure enough, it was much emptier than I expected after reading all the reviews. We were promptly seated - the decor was very classy, but not in an overdone way.  Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. He made some very detailed recommendations of food and wine that were accurate, and his subtle jokes and jabs made us feel like we were chatting with a good friend.  We started off with the chef's choice of oysters - 6 of them. They were delicious but also very small, and I wasn't feeling like we got our money's worth at all. Maybe it was because they were East Coast? Regardless, I wouldn't buy them at that price again.  I was jonesin' for some Asian flair, so I my chosen entree was the Togarashi Dusted Big-Eye Tuna, rare. The tuna was tasty and high quality, and the sauce it was in was pleasurably tangy. The waiter had told me to expect it to be spicy, but I didn't find it spicy at all - maybe the seasoning on the tuna had a subtle kick, but not much. What surprised me most was the rice cake. I was almost as excited about it as the tuna, which is definitely not something I expect for rice! It is a clump of sushi rice that is quickly dipped into a flash-fryer to crisp the outside into something so perfect that I'm considering buying a fryer just to try to replicate it. Combined with the sauce, it was divine. My one complaint about the dish was the pickled veggies that are stacked on top. I thought the sauce was super tangy all by itself - the pickled flavor was just all too much. I couldn't eat them. But I cleaned the rest of my plate happily!  My boyfriend got the Scottish Salmon, which he also really enjoyed, especially the curry sauce that went along with it. He cleaned his plate completely! He is gluten allergic, and the waiter was very patient to go through the whole menu with him in detail and let him know what could be made gluten-free. They do not have a separate gluten-free menu.  Our bill came out rather high - 2 glasses of wine, 6 oysters, and 2 main courses came out at $90. We weren't concerned with the gift card in tow, but even with the great quality, it seemed kind of steep.  All in all, if you think a well-rounded meal for 2 at $90 is nothing to sneeze at, then by all means, visit Upstream! Otherwise, I'd save it for a special occasion.

b77QPd67ZrXUmaLBd5SYwA.text: We wandered over with some friends after a movie on Valentine's Day. We were really just going for a drink but saw the sushi menu and decided to order. The sushi was actually very good. Things were coming out really slow so that was weird considering it was 10pm and not super crowded. I can't comment on entrees but the sushi was good enough for us to makes return visit to try more.

GM6n73WYt7Wn0ObpjOT-JA.text: Went here the other night for dinner and had an excellent experience. The big eye tuna tacos appetizer is a must. Really crisp and refreshing. Kind of small but soo worth it. Great selection of draft beers on tap, as well as some good sakes. Had sushi for dinner. Can't remember the name of the roll exactly, something like yakahama, but it was really good. Also their tuna (maguro) sashimi was really fresh and delicious. By the way you have to ask to see their sushi menu. For dessert we got the vanilla creme Brule and chocolate tort with gelato. Both were out of this world. Great place to enjoy a fun night out, however be prepared to spend a little more than your average dining experience.

VVPJP2TKZ-4V4fWaY2onSg.text: After the Yelp event here where I heard about how fabulous the Sunday brunch is at Upstream, I brought Mrs. K to give it a try.  Great service from the staff, starting from the hostess who brough us to a semi-private booth to the waitress explaining the buffet and cooked-to-order process and even the busboy who refilled our water glasses. I thought it was interesting that the waitstaff was all dressed like chefs - I don't know if that's intentional or not, but I liked it.  As for the food, well, it was excellent! The usual buffet staples like a cooked-to-order omelet station and a slicing station. But also a huge raw bar with large prawns, oysters, clams and mussels. On another table, salads and savories and sweet treats. Bacon and grits and smoked salmon and fresh sushi more!  But where the brunch stands out is the tapas menu. From your waiter/waitress, you order delicious plates that are a perfect little bite. Egg benedict - one poached egg on a crab cake. Smoked fish tacos - a 2 inch corn tortilla filled with smoked fish with guacamole and salsa on the side. Belgian waffles. French toast. Oh, I am stuffed!  Parking in Philips Place isn't easy but Upstream sometimes offers complimentary valet parking. It's well worth the tip to save the headache of finding a spot in the parking deck.

9jKIAtFMmMJajjvqVYhsYg.text: Went to Upstream during Queen's Feast. Wonderful restaurant. Excellent service. The crab cakes were a standout! Had the lobster which was delicious. Would definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cakes! Yum!

75CDxqeoKt7mbFS0_71nKw.text: Our waiter made it a great experience. It's too bad I can't think of his name, but we sat in the bar area and arrived right before they started serving dinner.  For appetizers we had wings, crab dip and sushi.  My fav was the sushi. I expected a little more food to appear on my plate when the entree came, but the taste was standard and typical of a seafood restaurant that serves steak.  Prices are a little steep for the serving size, but the ambiance and service makes up for it.   Give them a try!

xwZD-7-njgN6uJknGR41NQ.text: well, this is most definitely a South Park restaurant. we went there for restaurant week and the food was extremely different to say the least. I think their biggest mistake was not to give you something mid meal to clean your pallet. I have a taste of everything I had and I'm not comfortable with that when paying a high price.  my wife and I and my father had the sea scallops and they were grey and under-cooked. As an appetizer I had the squid which was in a creamy sweet and sour sauce which I won't even attempt again, I think this is what ruined my meal. Just the flavor went through the whole meal.  Overall not a very good experience for me and I do not plan on visiting this establishment again.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sea scallops

G1qkHZCQhmMrGifLnU_rSg.text: Had dinner here tonight Great service by our waitress Jennifer She suggested our  entrees and she was right on with the Sea Bass and Duck breast Also with our dessert chocolate walnut cake was excellent Luke Andrews manager stopped at our table and checked on how everything was told him excellent  Nice to see both the wait staff and management  checking on things Will definitely go back

FO91aKSRO4qqXt7xEVawqQ.text: I really wanted to love Upstream, but it totally fell flat. We sat in the bar for some apps and drinks after a movie, and it was one disappointment after the next. The biggest disappointment of all was the management (and this is speaking from two people who worked and lived off of tips in the service industry for years). We weren't looking for anything but an acknowledgment and somehow felt like we were the ones causing problems.....so what happened...  We ordered shrimp dumplings and they came out raw. We sent them back and somehow were left to feel like we were being unreasonable. Call me crazy, but expect food to be cooked and want to make sure there are no risks to eating said food. New ones came out (they were great) but TOTALLY different than first ones of which the management said were "slightly undercooked" and he was "trained that most food was sushi grade." Call me crazy again, but just admit the mistake and we all feel good.   Lastly the bill came and Upstream has the audacity to charge $3.50 an oyster for Wellfleets ($42/dozen). Whaaaat!! I'm a Boston gal who knows her seafood. Never in my life have I seen someone charge that amount. Nevermind that the menu says they are $2.50 but they all of a sudden claimed it was a premium oyster at a different price.  I can forgive mishaps and mistakes - it happens to the best of us. I cannot accept management who is so cavalier and dismissing to their guests.  Prices are high here and that is no issue for me for great food and service, however not acceptable if you can't deliver on those fronts.

APyqRwSZ5g-FRWxDl7YuEg.text: My family was in North Carolina for my brothers' graduation from UNC Charlotte which happened to fall on the same weekend as Mother's Day. I was able to make reservations through opentable.com for our large group. The manager, Kevin, was quite accommodating. Service was attentive and friendly. The Mother's day brunch ($34.95) had a great selection of quality brunch items: tender braised short ribs, omelet bar, shrimp & grits, sushi, raw bar, dessert bar. Beautiful outdoor seating. Blood Mary left much to be desired in terms of garnish and flavor. It was quite bland.

S0WnXo1kk2VwX0frECzKwQ.text: Went to Upstream after finding it listed on an OpenTable Valentine's Day restaurant list.  Decided to take my girlfriend there on 15 FEB (avoid the rush) as she loves seafood.  Should have probably read the Yelp reviews before, but hey...   Anyway, we arrived at 19:35, five minutes after our reservation time.  Hostess sat us within ten minutes of arrival at a booth.  We ordered oysters and wine to start things off.  The half-dozen oysters (Chef's Selection) was good - the New York oysters were our favorites.  Wine is definitely overpriced at this plate, especially considering how little they give you!  We were very happy our visit coincided with half-price wine night, as that made the prices fall back to the "reasonable but still high" range.    For dinner, we tried the pecan crusted trout and the lobster special.  The wait was long, but the pecan crusted trout was well worth it - good meat with a good crust!  The lobster was a disappointment as it was overcooked.  We called the waiter over, and he promised to bring us a new one quickly.  Within ten minutes, we had a new lobster that was cooked more reasonably.    As compensation for the overcooked lobster, the manager comp'ed us a dessert.  We tried the passion fruit creme brulee which was quite nice.  Total bill came to $105 (dessert was comp'ed).    I would say that this restaurant is overrated for what it is.  While I like seafood, I think I can find it more reasonably priced elsewhere in Charlotte.  Ambiance was nice, but not worth the extra cost.

5SIDQ2TfHRqZ1f6_ibXZHA.text: If you wanna go for Sunday all you can eat brunch, it's gone. They changed it to a menu, which is available on their website.

dR1EVkIlJEBQfqyBvORWPA.text: 2016 is a great year to host women brunch celebrations. The highlight of my month long birthday celebration was brunch at upstream.    THE good: on the list of top Charlotte brunch experiences,  upstream holds the number one spot for me. They allowed my friends to make me feel amazing.  Known as an oyster bar- their excellent buffet food (Sunday before 4) bar is accompanied by amazing staff and beautiful decor.  I was delighted by the small plates and feeling great after 2 mimosas. My favorite were the oysters and crab cakes.   My eggs even can sunny side up (win).  The other good: this Charlotte favorite isn't a secret-upstream is for a mature audience and it was also the choice location for a retirement party in a private room.   Despite the large crowd of important people in other parties - our dedicated waitress showed us amazing customer service.   Can't wait to take my mom for Mother's Day.

WkSM4FAEUO1MvOCYxqkJng.text: My husband and I had an extremely disappointing experience at Upstream.  We arrived about 7:15 ish and it was not crowded and we grabbed 2 seats at the bar- next to the service bar area.  We waited...waited some more and at one point there was NO ONE behind the bar.  In addition, there was a server that would wander behind the bar and she didn't even acknowledge us.  Eventually we were greeted by a bar tender. I told her we had been sitting there for a bit and she explained that they were "under staffed"-    A few minutes later the manager came by and we explained what was going on.  We ordered edamame and it came out timely..but with DIRTY PLATES....I pushed the plates towards the bar.....I was a bit disgusted and we ate the food right from the container it was delivered in.  After what was too long of a wait for a restaurant that was NOT crowded my husbands duck came out cold.  I am not sure what it going on but it just seems that there is not the caliber of service or management as there used to be.    We ask that you address the above matters and bring Upstream back up to the dining experience that is used to be.  I am afraid to say that we will not be back for a while

3PZGKr5dTfnVMjT_bdW-Pw.text: Thanksgving? At Upstream?  They were open and served up an extravaganza and if this is any indication of their famed Sunday brunch I need to hustle over to Upstream this weekend.  The all you can eat buffet is pricey ($40) but I think I ate that much in oysters alone.  Offerings ran the gamete from delicious looking cheese plates and salads (I say looking because I didn't sample - saving my stomach space for...) the raw bar, mussels, clams, crab legs, oysters, shrimp, smoked salmon, several types of sushi.....etc etc etc.  Also five carving stations including traditional turkey but ranging to delicious Scottish salmon. Sides were a star, I loved the stuffing with duck sausage and the unexpected pairing of butternut squash and cherries. Also, the shrimp and grits. I went back just for a bowl-full.  Desserts were lovely but not as epic as the raw bar and included an actual gelato cart rolled in for the occasion, bread pudding, cobblers, blondies, pie - you know the drill its Thanksgiving, roll out of there.  Service was conscientious and over the top helpful in a non-cloying not-fake way.  i've had many a nice meal at Upstream over the years and they really out did themselves with their Thanksgiving buffet.

AhdfBQikaiDVIXjcu1eX-A.text: Great food, Great Ambiance, we couldnt have asked for more.  The wife and I went for date night and it was great. We ordered 2 apps, the spicy shrimp lettuce wrap with pineapple and mango's which was phenomenal, in addition to the we got the mussel pot as well. The mussel pot was a nice size pot, with good portions.  I ordered the Wood oven duck, which was made 3 ways that blew me away. My wife ordered the Sea Bass in which she ate every drop. The restaurant is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for. We plan on going back.  I also noticed that all the employees were asking " how we were enjoying the food, or how are we feeling", not just our server which was kind of nice. Even the bus boys cleaning off the tables were friendly. Great Job Upstream!

scfeEWTGxHrBZkBblO7CKw.text: Tonight we celebrated a birthday at Upstream that I do not think could've been topped! Our server was delightful, professional, and an excellent introduction to amazing fare! We were three and shared "The Rock", which was delectable and fun as we actually cooked our meat on a stone! For the main course we shared lettuce wraps, but with a fish, sans eye, with chili oil, herbs and a salt mixture- this dish was the most fun! Truly a wonderful experience and I promise to return for my birthday if not before!

nHFM6hDvXLzaxZsoaqZu0w.text: My husband and I ate there last night and everything from the service, to the ambiance to the food was amazing! We opted to sit in a booth in the bar area because they had music playing and was a bit more fun. Our server was Josie and she was extremely knowledgeable about the food and the menu and very prompt and attentive. We ended up ordering a variety of raw bar food (oysters, shrimp and ceviche) as well as sashimi and some sushi rolls and it was all fresh and delicious.  My favorite roll was the snap, crackle and pop roll and I loved the variety of oysters they had...yum! Overall.. excellent experience and we will be going back!

nFXTdCWer_95XWbz4KockA.text: It's been a while since we were here so we were looking forward to coming. Apparently two weeks ago they changed their menu and it is nothing like it used to be. We got the clams (so small and no dipping sauce), the sea bass appetizer (again small AND served in a plastic bag), the scallops entree which was so small and has a horrible flavor, and the halibut which was admittedly the best dish of the night. The bartender did not refresh my husband's ice cube when he ordered a second old fashioned but put a second one on top of the previous one (I know this might seem trivial but it just added to the overall poor experience). A couple who sat down next to us seemed equally disappointed in the menu change. Overall it was a terrible night and I hate we spent $175 on a meal we hated and left hungry and went somewhere else to eat. Hopefully they'll revert back to the old menu as the new Japanese fusion menu they're trying leaves a ton to be desired.

Gp-M2BzKTS-n229lji31JQ.text: First time here. Went to see Captain America (AWESOME!) and needed a place to eat before the show. Read a lot of good reviews so I figure I'd check it out.  Was by meself and welcomed by George the bartender. I did sit at the bar. George was great. Very personable and welcoming. I ordered the daily special: Halibut over a veggie succotash. Outstanding! Perfectly cooked fish and the veggies were flavorful. I chose a Chablis (yes the REAL Chablis from French Burgundy) and it paired wonderfully with the Halibut.  I didn't have time to try an app or desert. But the Entree was excellent! I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

KQ5kqpeOHtbjFXbwlo6dWA.text: We tried this place during Queens Feast- and were not disappointed! Knowledgeable, attentive service and waitstaff, excellent food, great outdoor patio/ambiance. My husband had the Chilean sea bass, and I had the trout. The burrata and heirloom tomato appetizer is great, but small portion for the price. Soup of the day was a corn or crab chowder, and that was tasty as well.  I highly recommend for date-night. Great experience, food, and ambience.

rGY1C70vzCrC2NOdAkykkg.text: I love Upstream!  By far my favorite restaurant in the South Park area of Charlotte. They receive fresh seafood every day directly from fishermen not from distributors. They update their menu frequently so the restaurant never gets old. Last night I ordered black grouper, my entree included a very generous piece of grouper with bok choy and peppers. The grouper was cooked to perfection.  Being from Florida, I am very critical about grouper.  This was definitely real grouper and it was a very fresh piece of fish. If you have the opportunity to go to dinner at a nice restaurant in the South Park area, I highly recommend upstream.

Cle8q5Tw7Y39sVFiIKd03Q.text: Dinner Apr 17   Stumbled upon this place and glad I did.  Very nice and classy restaurant.  Super competent and professional wait staff.   Had the Calamari and it was unique.  We asked for some additional wasabi dressing to spice it up a bit.  It was very tasty and not huge in size.   Kale salad was very pleasing to the taste buds as well.   Loved the bread, the dipping oil was very tasty and I also asked for some butter and that added even more flavor to the bread.   The Flounder with Risotto was perfectly prepared and just the right amount of food to risotto ratio.  The sauce over the entree was a great accompaniment to the fish and risotto.   Did you know how serious Upstream is about their food?  They bring their fish and seafood in fresh daily!     I will definitely be back!

8RjjyOXGhDh5vZdjGs_7Hg.text: Disappointed every time I've gone...won't be trying it anymore!!

yG9dLBGBfJCR8Cjn3F1B1A.text: We had had a disappointing meal several weeks ago, but they invited us back to give them another try. I ordered the same dishes (steamed mussels, sea bass, and salmon roe sushi) and all were perfectly prepared this time. The Maitre d' and general manager were both very attentive. Jennifer, our server, was excellent. They have redeemed themselves and we will definitely be backed!

SGrOWq60zjv_gAR6WRf8nw.text: I was amazed on my first visit to Upstream. I even went with high expectations since it was ranked Charlotte's #1 restaurant according to one website. I ordered the Pad Thai which was very rich and tasty, and it even came in a fancy slanted white bowl. The second time I went I ordered Pecan Crusted Book Trout, which was also very tasty. (Although not as memorable as the pad thai.) The restaurant looks very nice both on the exterior and interior, service is great, and food is phenomenal. I can see why this place was ranked #1 in Charlotte.

UzDr7757xWkpkf_BfJBrcA.text: visiting from charleston, sc with 6 others.  we had a nice time in the back private room.  the service was attentive and the waitress was knowledgeable about the specials.  this is a seafood restaurant with asian fusion influences.  i started with the lobster bisque which was average at best.  however, the scottish salmon entree was delicious; perhaps the best salmon entree i've had in a restaurant.  (i'm not a great salmon fan.)  the rest of my party enjoyed dishes like the calamari appetizer and the entrees Mediterranean whole sea bass and grilled filet.  there also was a nice touch where you could mix and match fish, sauce, and a side (i think it was called 'simply sides').  the wine list was considered very good by the oenophiles in the room.  it was overall a pleasant experience.

s5TsXX4qFNsUu-QR8a2QzA.text: Giving this place 3 stars mostly for the service and the calamari appetizer which were both excellent.  I ordered the Tuna steak with Jasmine rice.  It was good, not great.  Pretty much just a piece of fish with no seasoning and zero effort was made on plate presentation   I asked for some wasabi oil and that at least gave it a bit of flavor.  My date had the Mahi Mahi with butter which I tasted and it did have a nice flavor to it.  I thought the place was bit pricey for what they were serving up which was nothing fancy.  The outside dining overlooked a retail store and their track lighting spot lights were way to bright for dinner.  I don't know the dining scene in Charlotte too well as I was visiting, but I did read a lot of favorable reviews for this place so maybe compared to other places in Charlotte this is a real treat for the locals.  I probably would not go back.

IY5qx8priZRL1Rs2zruRzQ.text: we were hoping for more of a sushi restaurant but this is much more of a fish restaurant.  the sushi was good but the nigri was expensive compared to other places we have been.  with all the other choices out there - we probably won't be back.

e3ILvVJOftqNCDzdJtN7nQ.text: I have been going to Upstream for the past 15 years and cannot believe I have not written a review yet.  Years ago this was my go to spot for Seafood.  However, over the last few years I have tried so many of the newer places I haven't gotten back here in a while, and that was my bad.  A few months ago I met up for drinks and appetizers with a Meetup Group and enjoyed the updated bar and offerings.  Although I have seen better Happy Hour prices, the food and drinks were great! I enjoyed the Shrimp Tempura, it was cooked to perfection. A light batter with an amazing sauce.  The sushi was great as well, and the others I was with enjoyed their choices as well.  After being impressed with the food I have since been back for dinner and just this past weekend enjoyed Easter Brunch.  Let me say Upstream offers a great brunch.  Not only do they have a spread, and I mean an entire room, of salads, shellfish, carving stations, hot meals and desserts, they also offer a la carte entrees that can be served individually and brought to your table hot from the kitchen. Some of those items included a trout/crab cake benedict, shrimp and grtis, veggie frittata, and a few more.  The food was all delicous and the service was spot on.  It seemed Upstream was very organized for this day and I will look forward to getting back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Tuna Hand Roll
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Tempura
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Spritz

olRvOJugRUZun79C0YAw5g.text: I can't say enough about the new Pan-Asian menu!  Ive always had favorites at Upstream, but the new fare is making me forget the old. I now crave the Green Papaya salad and the Chicken Karaage. They cook amazing duck for that salad and who knew fried chicken could be so tasty with a Japanese flair! The Bronzino was light but flavorful.  Krispy Fish and Pork Belly wraps were amazing and the portions were generous. We also tried The Rock, sliced NY strip you cook on a piping hot rock at the table. My husband ordered a second one it was so fun and tender! The Hot to Trot cocktail kept me ordering more and wondering why we waited so long to get out and give the new chef a whirl. Cheers!

PN_xPUFfL5aK7wrrjHW1hA.text: It's restaurant week so my friend & I decided to try this place since we're seafood lovers and neither of us have been. We tried to make same day reservations, but with it being restaurant week they were fully booked. However, the lady I talked to on the phone said since there's only 2 of us we shouldn't have a problem finding a seat in the bar/lounge area and the earlier we get there the better. Glad she told us this because we probably wouldn't have gone had she not being we live like 40 mins away. We got there around 6 and there was plenty of seating both at the bar and tables in the lounge. I started with the spicy salmon roll, had the lobster for entree which came with potatoes & a small salad with some type of vinegarette and apple crumble for dessert. All were very good! My friend stated her crab cakes were average and had too much breading - I tried some of the chocolate ganache she had for desert and that was yummy! Service was excellent as well 5/5. Will definitely back!

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

8tqWmfyPiAtBxc7XRim9og.text: Possibly the one of the top three best places for fish in Charlotte. Service is wo derful - at the front door as well as wait staff.   We ordered the Lump Crab cakes, the Dug Potatoes with asparagus, Sea Bass, and Salmon. All incredible - in flavor, proportions, plating, temperature.   Each dish had its own flavor theme, and they were reproduced flawlessly. Nothing had too much garlic, too much ginger or any mistake.   This is hard to do: run a kitchen with quality food (especially fish) and quality versions to the table each time.  I will return here, and even enroll in the cooking classes they offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lump Crab Cakes app. Wonderful flavor, pickles cabbage with mastered seed infusion.
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. The salmon with an avocado puree that includes a spicy twist and a sprout mix, with flavor of a little side of grapefruit and soybeans.
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dug Potatoes side, which are sautéd with asparagus and red onions.

8HCq_MjMwA7mhqZTHItZMA.text: We really enjoyed the whole experience at Upstream. The staff was very friendly and highly knowledgeable. It seems to get better and better each time we go here. Plus the food is great as well. They stated that they will have more dairy free items on the menu soon.

Kj9rN2RwqFGhbQHAJYclmA.text: I am not sure what this restaurant was trying to accomplish when they redid their menu,  but it is Horrible. They took off so many of their good favorites that they had before. I honestly want in there and had one drink that was way too expensive, left and went somewhere else. Perhaps they can rethink about bringing some of their old items back.

BScDwvXBo8IegRF6l0q9NQ.text: Not a BIG fan maybe it was the Queens Fest Week menu and experience but needless to say it was underwhelming. My husband and I take Datenight seriously as we have 2 teenage daughters & a toddler son so anytime alone away from home is very appreciated to just catch up with each other outside of our busy family schedule and work.   We were excited to try Upstream during Queen Fest Week (Restaurant Week) and the service was subpar to be frank. We were not treated as we expected in such an establishment. We were dressed to that nines and excited to be out. I even made the reservations on OpenTable as I always do when the restaurant is on opentabel and added notes about it being Datenight for my hubby and I. I'm use to restaurants reading notes to take into consideration any special request or to just see if they could get some info on the patrons coming into the establishment and acknowledging them accordingly. This was not the case for us and even after sharing with our server while asking about bottles of wine he still acted unenthused (lol) don't get me wrong I'm not looking for a parade or streamers for being on Datenight I just thought it would make the server smile or chop up some small talk (it ALWAYS does at various restaurant with really good service).  The cost to eat at this place to me warrants some type of happiness in the service as they are there in a position to service customer which is customer service and they should be a little bit appreciative for having work as so many don't. The food was not very good to my husband and I. Maybe we had a bad taste in our mouth already. We both vowed to try this place again to give them a fair go.  Once we do I will update my review (Addendum) accordingly.

GLvXavYhRONOI6G6jhLN_Q.text: Really kind of disappointed. Visiting from out of town. Dined with two vegan friends that specified their diet to the server. They were served salmon roe in their meal. The manager came out to discuss the reason for roe and didn't seem to grasp their diet. Dinner was incredibly slow to get to us for an otherwise not busy night. Food was mediocre at best. Curried potatoes had little to no curry flavor.   Overall will not suggest the restaurant. For the price there's better places in charlotte.

RAOKv-WDxOIcftTlxjI9BA.text: Upstream. First time here. Came for brunch. Met my friends. Friends are awesome. We sat in the lounge. Our server may have also been the bartender. She had great difficulty keeping coffee cups replenished. Don't you hate that at brunch?   The brunch buffet/set up looked nice. The large peel and eat shrimp were delish. I am not Rachel Ray.The sushi was decent. The prime rib was tough. Some of the oysters were slimy. The Bloody Mary's are small and average.  The breakfast basics were good. You can order things from the Tapas menu that are included. The crab cake benedict was good. I am using short sentences in this review. Can you order tapas more than once? I don't know. Our waitress only asked once. Tapas selection looked better than buffet. We still tipped generously. Why? Because we are cool people. We appreciate the service of others even though it may be lacking at times.   In summary. Okay. Not great. Not terrible. Average brunch. Average Charlotte price. Our server - not so hot. Brunch at Georges Brasserie is wayyyy better. No I am not an employee there.  The end.

2-Zv34tjDo9WtZuZaJl9lw.text: Im so disappointed in my 2go calamari portion for $13. This is unbelievable. This was less than a kids meal portion at mcdonalds. I waited 15 minutes for 4 or 5 broken pieces of calimari. NO, NO, NO, unacceptable portion & presentation for this price. I shall never spend another dollar there.   They need to try to keep their few customers happy considering there were not many patrons flocking to that establishment anymore.

bjERcIRlb4t7aVUxfgK0KQ.text: How have I gone so long without indulging in the perfection that is Upstream?   Where do I begin? I made reservations for a friend and I for restaurant week. I did so because the entire menu looked fabulous, and actually had desserts that I could eat despite my egg allergy. I did not expect to be blown away.  Three courses was all it took to make me a believer. Actually, it only took one, but I insisted on continuing to eat.   The starter that left me speechless was the curried cauliflower soup. I contemplated asking for a gallon to take home, but didn't want to take their entire stock. It was that good!!! There were scallops, perfectly creamy cauliflower, and fried onions on top. My goodness, I'm craving it now.  My main course was a beautiful braised short rib dish with creamy squash and grilled boy choy. The portion was spot on, but I made sure it lasted so that I could savor each flavor. The short rib was tender, so tender that it fell off the bone, and the squash was a welcome accompaniment. The bok choy however, superb! How could a vegetable stand up to the protein on the plate? I don't know, but it did!  The third course was an apple strudel, alas it wasn't what I asked for, but when they put it on my table...I didn't complain. It smelled divine and tasted like heaven. Gosh. I need to go back ASAP. Highly recommended!

MAZotCejA7ODwwJoOihsiA.text: The service is great!!! Food so fresh and delicious, no complaints! I will definitely come again

WX_VLUNgr3xbiEKG3eZ6nA.text: First off the place is nice. The atmosphere and the food we got was great for the most part. The reason I give it two stars is, one they brought my wife hush puppies with her meal that were grossly under done as in raw batter like it was filled with pastry cream. I mean this is the south there are a thousand restaurants around you that do hush puppies how can yours be so bad. Second I ordered a salad that never came. I was extremely excited to try this place and left feeling like I would probably never go back.

znf-9z1Jf2JW8q69tpe2Ig.text: Went here for Sunday brunch and it was packed and full of delicious choices, did not realize it was a buffet and it was $27! So I ate as much as possible trying to not look greedy in front of my friends.  They had salmon, prime rib, pork loin, and the brisket was phenomenally tender.  Shrimp and oysters and sushi. Mac and cheese was kind of velveeta shells-y but the squash casserole was so awesome I wanted to take the whole tray to my table.  Salad and bacon and said have and bread pudding and layered chocolate trifle. Desserts. And you could order French toast and waffles off the brunch menu for free. I asked for French toast but they forgot to bring it. You have to go for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch you gotta go!!!!

0RXj8x7cTxhxZRQ-zcoCiA.text: Yep! This place gets my approval as another solid Sunday afternoon brunch spot!   I came Sunday afternoon with about 10 girlfriends. Even with our large party, our waiters and waitresses were great. They kept clean silverware coming, tapas plates by the tower (basically we ordered everything on the menu and they brought them out three plate with different options at a time) and our water, tea and mimosa were always full!   The brunch selection was phenomenal!  Here are a few of the highlights for me:  -Made to Order Omelets -Salmon -Steak and Eggs -Fish tacos -Waffles -Shrimp and Grits (sooooo good) -Fried chicken -Ribs -Bacon and Sausage -Mac and Cheese -French Toast  As if that weren't enough you also get your choice of salads, sushi, fruits and if there's any room left they even have desserts!   Seriously, there's no way you'll leave here hungry. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

UGpPizUxviBeUI3Zuh_cQA.text: Amazing seafood dinner.  Everything we had was spectacular. Great martinis.  Green papaya duck confit salad.  Crab cake croquets.  Lobster with foie gras dumplings.  Passion fruit profiterole.  Not a single thing that was not outstanding.  Friendly and fun wait staff.  We went for Queen's Feast week so it was a little cheaper than normal, but it easily would have been a good deal at a higher price.  Definitely recommend!

ktyFlaQVC4nQafvx7hOkOQ.text: The service at Upstream is always outstanding. They recently changed the entire menu in the restaurant and bar area.  We have been twice since the changes because this is one of our favorite restaurants. We've had private parties here. The new menu is a huge disappointment - too drastic of a change. This is now a Japanese restaurant not a seafood restaurant.  The sushi menu now has less options.  We went on a Friday evening and the place was pretty empty - assume others don't like the changes either.  We won't be going back.

da4TE_BGZo0A2mwJ7wVqAA.text: Amazing quality seafood.  Went with my wife and we got 3 appetizers and 2 entrees (the appetizers are small...good things come in small packages).  Everything we got was good including the creme brulee to top it off.  Service was good but one side dish I ordered was forgotten and a sushi menu was never offered to us (would have loved to have tried it)... so not quite 5 star service...but close.  The food is so good the service could have been terrible and I still would have rated this place high.  Yelp says this place is "dressy" so we wore business casual.  Many patrons had on jeans and one dude was wearing shorts...so next time I'll be a little less dressy and a little more comfortable.

KLxYMPv8h_A41p-1V1MsUQ.text: I had the opportunity of eating here for the first time ever and let me tell you that it was some of the best seafood I've ever ate. We started with appetizers. We shared the oyster salad and not just standard Calamari, but sweet and sour calamari, which was very unique and tasty. For the main course I had the Sea bass and my dinner date had the lobster, both were fantastic! The best part of the dinner was our waiter, Yekta, who was one of the best waiters I've ever had. I can't wait to come back and I'll definitely be requesting Yekta for our waiter.

bEMhlNVfNJ1uVw6tAxfWOA.text: Wicked weed on tap however I simply could not get over how tiny the food was. Two tiny tiny tacos will run you $13. The bartender was very nice though.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tiny tiny tiny food. Just enough to make you hungry.

Pcp_lIGwdFgEOr53OYXY9Q.text: My husband and I don't often have a chance to go out to dinner. When we do, I want it to be wonderful. Tonight was our first time to Upstream and they did not disappoint us. Food was fabulous. Service was great. We will definitely come again.

9Eak8U5vgHnGGNwvzFvuqw.text: Love this place. Great selections and some real treats. Nice bar and nice little outdoor spot when weather cooperates. Service is good, but like anyplace, it depends on who you get and how busy they are. Over all, great place!

8tbRdfIzASxeqq54z71RAA.text: Likes: Great service. The calmari is the best that I've ever had - fresh, tender and not hidden behind a deep-fried batter. The sea bass is also the best rendition of this fish I've ever had.  Gripes: The shrimp & avocado ceviche was just ok and was missing the avocado. The restaurant is a bit loud and hard to hear everyone at a larger dinner table.

MGG5n_mGXyHrKVrrQ2SKRw.text: This is a review for my last night Restaurant Week dinner. And I am torn about how many stars I should give. Here is the thing, the service wasn't great, but as crazy as it sounds, it was the best bad service I ever had.  RSVP for 2 at 7:45pm, my friend and I arrived on time (gasp!). Hostess said there's a booth for us, but then she changed her observation (to no booth). We offered to wait in the bar area if that's easier, but she pretty much told us they've been behind on schedule and best for us to not miss a table when one is available. We stood around for a few minutes awkwardly (my friend was desperately needing a drink apparently), and finally we got sat in the 1st side room on the left, at a 4-top (with only 2 chairs) toward the back, next to a party of 10.  Water person (what's the PC term for water boy?) came and filled our glasses. And that was as much action as we received for 10+ minutes. It's starting to bring back the memory of my Fahrenheit nightmare. Ironically I'm with the same friend! I think he and I and fine dining just don't belong together. Meanwhile the 2 waiters assigned to tables around us just came and gone and never even batted an eye at us. I finally waved down the water person and softly asked him "who's our waiter?"   My simple question led to an array of apologies. Manager showed up and offered us drinks and brought us menu. We got assigned a waiter, we placed an order of the chef's choice half dozen oysters and the night slowly proceeded. By slowly, I meant we didn't finally leave the restaurant until 10 to 10pm. Thank goodness the 2 of us have known each other for years, and had plenty to chat about. It would have killed any potential if it was a 1st date situation. Imagine the silence...  Food wise the RW menu was solid. There are plenty of options (and not just salad). Essentially the entire menu was up for grab, some involves up-charge. I personally was perfectly fine with my seafood soup (it's not very curry, don't let the name scares you), my 1-lb lobster (split in half, and amazingly they left all the brainy gooey goodness for me to tear into, though some may argue the meat itself was a little overcooked) and creme brulee. It definitely worths the $30. My friend had the NC shrimp salad (huge portion, not sure if I liked the dressing, but it's whole shrimps on greens), seared tuna over rice cake (definitely digging the rice cake), and flourless chocolate tart and ice cream. Tuna has a small up-charge (I'm thinking $6).  At the end, they pretty much comp everything but our dinner. 2 managers have repeatedly apologized for the service. I couldn't even be mad at anyone. I guess if I'm to have bad service, it's best when they owe up to it and try hard to make up for it without me even having to ask. We didn't expect them to comp ALL the drinks (I only had 2 glasses of wine, but my friend went all out on his double vodka tonic). We made it up on tip because it's not our server's fault.  So at the end, it was a good night and a great dinner. I decided that 4-star is deserving given the circumstance.   Food - 4 Value - 5 (for Restaurant Week) Service - 2 Afford - 5 (lol)

VlB82MuRQU9HZOWDZA7ZbQ.text: The food is amazing!  The staff (Susan both times I've been) is very knowledgable and definitely will steer you in the right direction. They are accommodating and welcoming! My 2nd time trying octopus. The 1st time (at another restaurant) didn't go so well, so this time, made me a believer! My mahi mahi with blue crab fritters: shut up. The blue crab fritters were super light "hushpuppy-ish" on a spicy oil. That paired with my Pinot Noir... The fish was perfectly flaky! Well, I thought I was happy until I got to my dessert. That was hands down the best vanilla ice cream and the perfect pairing with the flourless chocolate torte. All in all, I definitely recommend spending time here!

mOeS5Gvfd2bSXbkc0ESjYw.text: So I have to confess.....I have been a bad patron of this amazing place!!!!! But I have good reason, I don't live right behind there anymore. So I have started going back and let me just say the place has gotten even better! The food was OMG amazing, the service great, overall restaurant perfect. Drinks were soooo smooth and good....got our drink on, and it made us order more food - we ate bar bites. Shrimp tempura and lobster tempura - lets just say more please!!!! I am making an effort to start going there more often, and I will be back this week on Wed.......counting the hours......  Such an amazing place.

T_APNMQkXvBTbWH-f-bkTg.text: I normally do not give bad reviews, however I feel I need to share this so no one else will be disappointed. The Sunday brunch buffet is overpriced for the selection served and the shrimp and grits have barely any shrimp.

nEsWiWi62A7kaZ0K1q_CpA.text: What I love most about this place is the customer service. The live is alive and well in the South here.  I had the steak and potatoe (had fancier name)it was good but it wasn't memorable.  The servers and cook came over 4 or 5 times to check in on us and the food.

opkT1lcp3Hr01fZFDYNWxQ.text: It had been a while for me and Upstream hanging out together. We had broken up over brunch one Sunday, but I was ready to give them another chance for dinner.  I was here for a business dinner and all in all it was a pleasant experience for everyone. The menu is seafood heavy and we wound up ordering calamari and mussels to share. The tomato sauce for the mussels was some of the best that I have had in a long time. The calamari was good too, but nothing to get too excited about as it  was pretty standard calamari.  For entrees, we all chose a different fish option from tuna, bass, halibut and black grouper. I had the grouper and it was a great dish. The menu describes it as "Tim Griner's Line caught NC Black Grouper" and the fish was definitely fresh and cooked to perfection. It was accompanied with local field peas, sweet corn, wood oven roasted tomatoes, bacon and a ramp vinaigrette. I would definitely order this plate again, unless one of the other fish or specials was calling my name. Service was good and certainly better than I have had in the past here. They were busy on the weeknight that we stopped by so there were a lot of servers running around.  So I guess that my relationship with Upstream is back on again, but I think that we can both agree that it's ok for us to see other people as well.

yYgnxxpbStQMppFSHH7MCw.text: I brought my partner to Upstream for his first visit.  We had a table in the middle of the dining room.  I love the look and decor of Upstream (especially the ceiling!) so this felt very cozy.  The only disturbing thing about it was the noise level.  There's no wall between the cozy dimly lit dining room and the loud blaring kitchen.  I understand (and enjoy!) the concept of "open kitchen" dining, but I think that should be reserved for different types of restaurants.  The open kitchen didn't feel right for an upscale seafood restaurant that can/should be used for special occasions and dates.    Anyway, we had fantastic service.  Just be prepared to enjoy an hour and a half relaxing meal.  To start, we tried the bento box appetizer, which was a combination of different things (sashimi, sushi, beef, eggroll), but I think next time I would go with just a couple of sushi rolls.  We also splurged and added the flash-fried calamari as it sounded so good when our server was describing it to us.  And she was right.  It was very tasty and not at all chewy. It also didn't include the baby squids with attached tentacles that you might normally find in calamari dishes.  The only disappointing thing was the portion size.  Good thing we got the bento box, too!  I ordered the sea scallops for my entree and chose the Japanese ponzu sauce (there are 5 choices!) to go with it.  The three tennis ball-sized scallops had a LOT of flavor to them and the fingerling potatoes on the side were tasty, too.  Again, though, the portion was pretty small, but with all things added up, we were full by the end of our meal.    All in all, we had a very enjoyable experience, but I can't say that when thinking of places to go in the future, I'd return anytime soon.  There are so many other options out there and Upstream didn't "wow" us enough to return time and time again.

-s5rD_qZEPyTHu4SH-l3ow.text: Went for the first time today... or so I thought ..... after going inside realized I had been here before a few years ago but it was not memorable in a most negative way...      I read the menu last night..  had no interest in a buffet brunch.... totally off buffet food basically because people don't care about others so who know s what little extras you would consume ....  Anyhow .... I was under the assumption the lunch menu would also be available .... found out SundAy's it is not..   I should give the place a chance for lunch on another day or dinner.... I probably won't...  Best    Me ...  PS met the owners on a plane some years ago on route the Bahamas ... they were very special ..... ha

KQKziMcynAOZ9ntevG6C8Q.text: I live right by here and go a lot. Staff is super friendly, food always excellent & great selection.  I usually just sit at the bar and order tea and dinner. It's more casual than the dinning area and I go alone often.  It is expensive, but you know that going in and it's ALWAYS worth it. The freshest and best quality seafood in town. I'd rather pay more for excellent than a little less for mediocre. They have oyster specials for $1 through the week during certain times and from 5-7pm a bar bites menu where many rolls and food is 1/2 off. Great time for dinner. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster w wasabi butter. Yummmmm!!!

7pmhRCuYaYB98tvg_oBe9g.text: Overpriced for the quality.   I only had sushi and oysters so can't speak for the rest of the menu but overall I was dissapointed with Upstream.   The sushi rolls were mediocre at best and their version of New Style sashimi was pretty terrible. It was basically dried out, overly thin and the flavor was not good.   The only saving grace was that it was happy hour and according to the menu the items marked with an * were half price.... Or so I thought until the bill came. Turns out the sushi menu is very misleading and it was full price which amounted to just less than $90 for two rolls, a poorly prepared salmon sashimi and half dozen oysters which I left the selection to the server who of course picked the "non happy hour" ones...  I've paid $200 for omakase at sushi restaurants out west and happy to do so if the quality is right but this was way off the mark.   Definitely wouldn't recommend as I assume there must be better quality sushi in the Charlotte area.   I gave it 2 stars instead of one because the service from the waitsatff was very good despite the food.

cweKUsfc8wRjelGrsCAfew.text: I usually am skeptical about inland sea food restaurants. I have not been here for many years , what a pity. The food is excellent , wine list is good and service is also very good. I will be back here next time I am in Charlotte, even thought it is a bit of a trip.

A-Sbqedj29jTNrOfuIXBPg.text: My husband and I were so disappointed in this restaurant! We had made a reservation for Thanksgiving dinner. The first table the hostess attempted to seat us at was crammed in the bar right on top of the adjoining table. We asked for something different and we were rudely forced to wait. Once we were finally seated, we were ignored by the wait staff for 15 minutes before someone stopped to ask if we wanted a beverage, but we had no beverage menu. I guess we were supposed to just guess at what was available. Again, we were ignored by the wait staff over and over and over again while they hustled around to the surrounding tables. When our waiter finally realized we had been there over 30 minutes without so much as a greeting, he did apologize but he continued to pay extra attention to every other table but ours. The meal was buffet, and every time we went in for a serving - the dishes were cold and empty! We waited time and time again for more dishes to be brought out but almost everything was cold in the serving trays. Oh, and the prime rib was RAW! I love Rare prime rib - but this was RAW! Save your money! We $150 for 2 people and it was not worth the money! If you were looking for very subpar food and service - by all means enjoy. My husband will not be returning. Ever.

gLZTJonF5I_k1XG0OB39CA.text: My boyfriend was a gem and treated me to a surprise date night during Restaurant Week. Unfortunately, he didn't try to make a reservation until we were on the way to Upstream... Opps. (I still think he gets an A for effort, no?) We were pleasantly surprised that we could walk in and eat in their cozy bar area, which to me, was just as good as sitting in the dining area. What a great option!  Our server was courteous, professional, and prompt. She truly knew her stuff and was very patient when it came to questions about the wine and strong pairings. We shared a nice bottle of wine; he enjoyed clams as an appetizer and I the Lobster Bisque. For our entrees, I had the Scallop Pad Thai and he the Tuna. All we cooked to perfection with really strong infusions and personality. It's very apparent that the Executive Chef really has a talent and is extremely accomplished and takes the considerations of his food and creations quite seriously. The presentation was spot on and it was extremely apparent that the food was made with very fresh ingredients. Ever have a meal where you just feel heavy? Though I did a number on my entree, I left feeling content and truly satisfied.  What sold me on why I will always be a fan and look forward to return visits is how their management team responded to an 'incident'. During our appetizer, my boyfriend chipped his tooth while eating clams, as a clam was not shucked just right. The server and manager offered their deep, True apologies and then offered to take care of any dental fixes. I was really impressed by they're concern and jumping right into to offer a fix. Bravo!

TIRl9AgcoJ3-ebNMMRFnBA.text: It's a great sea food restaurant, I had a few dinner there and l liked it. But I recently found out the lunch menu is great too and much cheaper. I live behind the restaurant, when I take a walk every morning, I see a sea food truck stops at the restaurant around 9 am everyday, which means you get fresh sea food everyday! Try the fish sandwich at lunch!!

QyKLIidE1J7graIgfpsmPQ.text: Left hungry, Really!  some items on the menu we tried were good, Oyster corn chowder was excellent. Fish on the other hand came out in a soupy mess of uncut vegetables. Crab cake app was bland. Shrimp appetizer consisted of 2  shrimp some what large, but they were not fillet and stuffed with crab either. No seasoning. Bring your Tony's and tabasco, You will need it.  W

Z2t86IbGPdTyh3SNYeY2TQ.text: Phew, where to start with this place!!!!!!????   This review is from a 1 time dinner experience on a Saturday.   The ambience is excellent.  Comfortable seating, spacious, and beautifully decorated.  Fun crowd that is business casual.   Our service was excellent.  Really personable, made some solid recommendations and just really pleasant.    The food was INCREDIBLE.  Let me spare your time and tell you that if you a very fresh tasting seafood dish whether it be sushi or oysters...go here.  Presentation is great, portion size is nice, flavors outstanding.    Overall, one of my best meals ever.

jntoFTKm5UpxcUXHukZEkg.text: We went for the Sunday brunch.  So good it was worth getting fat for.  Everything was super fresh,  our Waiter was totally on the ball and the perfect mesh of attentive without being intrusive, plus he totally didn't judge me for my third order of french toast.  *I* judged me, but it was too good to care "Look away, I am going to lick my plate now..."  I don't think there was a single thing I didn't love and the fresh omelette was sooo good.  The veggies were all perfectly cooked and super fresh.  My friends and I have agreed, this is now a weekly tradition that we intend to diet the rest of the week for.  Side note: The food was so good even my picky four year old sat quietly and ate.

49zxiM8rEpLfkp5vLAovcw.text: Since the closing of LaVecchia's Seafood Grille, my thirst for upscale seafood in the Queen City has gone largely unquenched.  That is, until now, when I had the chance to go to Upstream this past Thursday evening for dinner with my dad.  Food:  In case it hasn't dawned on you yet, this is mostly a seafood spot.  Therefore you should probably at least have a taste for good, fresh, seafood before dining at Upstream.  To begin with, we ordered a trio of appetizers - the Sweet and Sour Calamari, Lump Crab Cakes, and the Black Iron Mussel Pot.  All of the appetizers were different than similar renditions I've had of these popular seafood dishes.  The calamari was not your traditional fried and breaded calamari.  Instead, the calamari was pan seared, not breaded at all, and served tossed in a thick sweet and sour sauce - very tasty!  I loved the MUSSELS!  The tomato-garlic sauce the mussels are served in suited me perfectly.  The crab cakes were probably my least favorite of the apps - they were good, just not great.    We split the salmon for our main course.  The salmon was, in a word, flawless. It was super tender, succulent and bursting with flavor! The pearl pasta and scallops it was served on top of, was the perfect compliment.    Ambiance:  As we were able to be seated right away, we really did not have a chance to tour the restaurant that much.  But from what we were exposed to, I certainly have no complaints.  Quiet, classy, upscale, friendly, chic, are all adjectives that come to mind when I think of the ambiance at Upstream.    Service:  Let me just say, our server, Brooke, was super friendly and was one of the most professional, knowledgeable servers I've ever encountered.  She was knew the menu from front to back.  She was willing to accommodate any request we might have.  The only thing that topped the delicious food was the unforgettable service.    I think my seafood crusade can finally come to a rest - I've finally found in Upstream, what I've been so desperate for over all these years  - great service, upscale ambiance, and fresh, quality seafood.

Jkv9pH5CmhS5v90_UIv37Q.text: I'm really torn here between a 3 and a 4 star review. If not for my most recent visit to Upstream I'd have given 4 stars. I've only come for brunch though, if that's any disclaimer.  On that note, generally speaking the brunch is good stuff. Their buffet carries a wide selection of options from gourmet to staple southern eats. There are raw oysters and cocktail shrimp to mac and cheese to charcuterie to sushi to cuts of roast beef to cheesecakes and cobblers. There's really no rhyme or reason to it, not that it's a bad thing. I think people like the options. Of course have bloody marys and mimosas. They also pass you a menu of about six small dishes you can special order straight to your table. These include shrimp and grits, trout (my favorite!), a mini omelette, Belgian waffle and eggs benedict. I'm mostly disappointed in their choice to remove the shrimp and grits from the buffet and put it on the menu. I suppose it is still endless though.  I never can complain about the flavors of things here. I like most of what they serve but for a majority of it I wouldn't say that it's worth the hefty price of $25+ for all you can eat brunch. We all know we never get our money's worth at buffets anyways. The service is also a bit spotty so I would find it difficult to further justify that high cost. The experience in general isn't bad. The location and atmosphere in the restaurant is an attempt at fancy that clashes with the buffet style set up and some of the more basic food offerings.  Ultimately I'm not saying I wouldn't come back here but it wouldn't be anytime soon simply because of the price point. I'm going to be out searching for better quality at this price.

su5Jqnu1idTWEWIh_sXZXg.text: Went during restaurant week! I enjoyed the shrimp appetizers and the Lobster. I need to get back there to have more! The service was great. They were attentive but not over the top. I am looking forward d to trying their cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

MRtX9mKHQo4Ur-BSdJI7cQ.text: Got some time to kill? Great! Be prepared to sit in here no less than an hour. Every time we come here the service is incredibly slow regardless of how few people are sitting down to eat.  Today, for example, (August 5) I came in alone and sat at the empty bar and had 3 sushi rolls and it all took over an hour.   I stood in the entrance for a couple of minutes as the first couple in front of me was seated. The hostess came back to answer the phone, still not acknowledging me to tell me just a second or placing the call on hold. I ended up seating myself at the bar, assuming bar service here would be as attentive as literally anywhere else.   It sat at the bar for about 5 minutes without being acknowledged by the two people appearing to be working the bar. They would pop in the bar to make a drink and leave...they didn't stick around. After it was painfully obvious I was there and not leaving, then I was given some water and menus. About a minute later I was asked if I was ready to order. I was not I had just been given a menu I am not in the least familiar with. Nobody came back for over another 10 minutes. After someone finally came back around my order was taken and the sushi arrived quickly. Seems the only person being efficient in the bar area was the sushi chef. After I was finished with the 3 rolls (which doesn't take long for a person eating their first meal of the day at such an hour) I sat and waited for someone to to make an appearance for me to ask for the bill.   I arrived at 1:22pm and left at 2:31pm.  I didn't want to sit around. I was just grabbing some lunch at an uncrowded place before picking my husband up from Longview...but I was late .   I shop at Phillips Place regularly and that is the only reason I've kept giving Upstream a chance, because I'm there. I don't go because the food is just spectacular, it's ok at best. With better service, I could justify the cost as I do with many other places. Also, with better service, we all could have saved 30 minutes on this experience.   Seriously the biggest waste of time and worst $40 I've ever spent on 3 sushi rolls. I can guarantee it will never happen again.

6koHyhKejK-3uGqBAOpTBw.text: This place is awesome - we had been here once many years ago and had not been back till tonite.  The new menu is great - and the food is so so good.  I had banana leaf wrapped sea bass - the best I have ever had.  Our new favorite restaurant.

DPoQmGILC3rmBlP81eftZw.text: Even after more than a decade and a half, this place is still one of my favorite, dependable go to places for a celebratory contemporary meal in an elegant but non-pretentious setting. Great seafood spot with a fusion and Southern cooking twist that results in hearty meals, extensive drink choices, and catered ambiance.  Food is always creative and tasty but service seems to fluctuate between fantastic and inattentive pacing.  Can be a slight downer of you're with a large group waiting on your entrees for the night, but overall not a deal breaker.  Nice spot to be able to relax one on one or with a group to take your time, have great conversation, and create special culinary moments together.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. A sneak peak at the dessert menu, with both solid and liquid desserts.

aROAT_CYz8wunUuv3-YAwg.text: Went for New years day brunch. Brunch is unlimited but not buffet style. You order from your waiter two small plates at a time. Plates are small portions (example: calamari came with two pieces and sushi roll was 4 pieces). I wouldn't have minded any of this if service wasnt so slow. The plates are only a few bites but it took 10-15 mins to get your next plate. It took us almost 2 hours to taste everything we wanted on the menu and we were still hungry. Our waiter seemed overwhelmed and appeared to be annoyed whenever we ordered another plate. We also got some very fishy tasting oysters that we spit out immediately. Eventually, we were tired of waiting and just asked for the check. Only reason this gets any stars is because the food was actually very good (exception of oysters). Maybe I would go back to try their regular meals but brunch isn't worth the time or money. TL;DR brunch is only "unlimited" if your willing to spend a few hours and don't mind a grumpy waiter, however food was good

c5hEr_jgFc9wg3_3M7QgwA.text: The most amazing bar I have been to! Excellent customer service and knowledge beyond a millennium.  This place masked the best drinks and the food looked very unique. I feel bad for showing up after the place was closed.... The bar was open and man, was it impressive: an exclusive mixologist made my drinks... He asked what decade old fashioned I wanted, and asked if there was any other way to make a whiskey sour when I asked if they use egg whites!!! Wow, impressed, professional, no holds barred the best bar I have been to.

SP_HGc3ATBxceGrJuqwGMA.text: I'm currently kicking myself that I didn't come here sooner! Both myself and my husband were seriously impressed by our experience here. We came at a super random and off time (Memorial Day), and ordered a few cocktails, apps, and entrees. SO GOOD! Seriously, I don't think you could order a bad meal here.  The steamed sea bass was my favorite, but the crab cakes were equally incredible! The quality of the fish here is just beyond amazing, and I truly don't think a review can do it justice.
