x8KjKMSaIsEs3jsVH_9t2Q.text: Not the best food experience. Staff was very attentive but the food just did not deliver.  Salmon dish was cold , potatoes some cooked some hard..mg friend had the sea bass and it was over cooked.. the chicken sandwich was very tough seemed like dark meat extra fried .  Again, staff was great but food was not.

Ls34M-WiMxHlUic4ld2Z8A.text: We have done the Sunday brunch three times now. We love the fresh seafood like oysters, muscles, shrimp, and smoked salmon. There is a carving station and they always have different home style food to choose from. Very little on breakfast items. They do typically have breakfast meats. Also the tapas plates tend to be more breakfast oriented. We love the french toast, nice and gooey!  They also have a salad bar, sushi and a dessert station. The desserts have been different every time we have come. If you want to order a cocktail make your reservations closer to noon. If you want to avoid the crowd come when they are open. We tend to get there at 10:30 am right when they open and have the place to ourselves for a bit.  The staff is always exceptional from the hostess, to the servers, to the people restocking the food.  We like to treat this as our special occasion place.

3lg8-1kpiqa5gY8xKA_mpQ.text: Took a group to enjoy brunch for my besties birthday.  Small plates, seldom brought out timely. Many went without food, we were starving the whole time. Ended up picking up the tab, no discount, just apologies. We went to another restaurant. Total rip off. Don't waste your money or time.

Ir3DG2mtIOx3L0914s1ngg.text: Amazing dinning experience!  This is the place to be for any big celebration!  The service is excellent, they know how to treat you right.  The servers are very knowledgeable about every dish on the menu.  The sushi is outstanding...the super crunch roll is to die for!  I was celebrating a birthday, so I got the surf & turf for dinner which was excellent. KmFfpoF_r7I0z544qFrd-Q.text: Okay.... my husband and I used to ADORE this place. Apparently there is a new chef and the whole menu has turned into this weird asian fusion thing. All the menu items that my husband and I loved are completely gone. We ordered the east coast oysters which they were out of so they gave us the west coast oysters. The oysters were not very good. They were big but chewy and fishy. The only reason I gave this place a second star was because of our server. I believe his name was mark and he was incredibly nice and seemed to be the only server there that had his shit together. You could just tell he was extremely disappointed by the menu change as well as he told us he has worked there for five years. We left disappointed and probably will not return. Bottom line... if you loved this place and their food before I promise you will be disappointed if you return.

VFWBC76KVtT1MgS1Jf0VMQ.text: Upstream was one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. I had read about the changes at Upstream, I decided to try it by myself.   As a good food lover, I don't mind to pay more but I do care about well designed and well cooked healthy food. At Easter Sunday buffet, I saw big chunks of iceberg lettuce, devil egg, thick cut irregular shape raw country ham; quite a few side dishes thickened with flours and cream; and very oily asparagus. Spanish paella was so over cooked that the shell fishes were all completely dry.   The traditional Italian lasagna should be multi-layers with juice, tasty filling and cheesy topping. The lasagna I saw was baked in individually in 4" -5" shadow dishes with no more than two layers. Top was blacken and It was dry.  Upstream was famous for their fish cooking skills, their salmon use to be so tender and juicy. But yesterday's salmon was completely dry.   It was indeed a big change at Upstream.   The service was good and the waitress were very kind and helpful.

tzV6OXUD4WVnj9xff4Uhvw.text: Extremely busy tonight - usually love this place and the service is impeccable - we waited almost a half an hour for appetizer,  going to miss our movie so we said to cancel it and bring us our check -they ended up comping our drinks because the service was slow. This is a classy place!

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

nELAR_JaeTOBxZm2U_d24w.text: Last night at Upstream was amazing amazing AMAZING. This was my first time dining here (after many recommendations), so I decided to invite my foodie mom along with me. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated and classy, but not too stuffy that you can't laugh and enjoy yourself. Our waitress Corrine was attentive, but not overbearing, and personable. Even when her section got busier as the night when on, she grabbed a floor manager to visit our table if she couldn't to make sure we were not forgotten, and to accommodate us.  To start (we participated in the Queens Feast menu), we ordered the Thai Coconut Soup and Heirloom Tomato and Melon Salad. Both were delicious, but hands down, the soup was out of this world. For our entrees, we both ordered the Mahi Mahi with Sucotash. The fish was cooked to perfection, and whatever cream sauce that they put on top was so delicious, we asked for bread to make sure we got every last drop. And finally, my favorite part of the night: DESSERT! We both ordered the Bittersweet Chocolate Creme Brulee, and this was the most decadent and yummy dessert I've had in a long time dining out. Clean plates X3 for both of us. They also offered wine pairings for the Queens Feast menu at 3 glasses for $15, which is a steal (and they were pretty decent wines/pours at that). *I uploaded pics!*  Overall, the recommendation was right on point with our experience, if not better. The meal was well-paced and spaced, and at no point in time, did we feel rushed. We were greeted with smiles at the hostess stand, and every wait staff member was courteous and pleasant. Corrine was great, and the food was amazing. Upstream has definitely earned 2 more patrons. Cheers to a job well done!

Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bittersweet Chocolate Creme Brulee
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi Mahi with Corn Succotash

vsZl9zR0WUziadGobWxkwQ.text: I've been wanting to try Upstream for years and finally had the chance to enjoy the Sunday brunch buffet with family.  After being seated, our server breezed by to let us know he would be taking care of us and that he would be back to take our drink orders. We sat for nearly ten minutes before we were able to order drinks and be directed to the buffet.  It's critical to note here that Upstream was in no way busy at this time. I didn't see any other servers, so I'm left to believe that the gentleman taking care of us was the only employee on the floor.   Our drinks arrived well after our first trip to the buffet and only received sporadic refills. We had to flag him down more than once to ask for tapas from the supplemental brunch menu; once we each ordered something, he'd inaccurately relay the order back to us. We had to correct him each time.   From the time we arrived to the time we left nearly 90 minutes later, the buffet was never replenished. The spread appeared picked-over on our first trip and slowly deteriorated from there. The young man behind the carving station looked miserable at his post between the fruit fly speckled pineapple tray and the dried out sushi platter.   Near the end of our meal, brunch service began to wrap up. Employees swarmed the remnants of the buffet and weren't heard from again; when we left the place was like a ghost town.  If I were to try brunch again, I would go at the beginning of service so I knew I would get the full experience. There's a lot of room for improvement here.

HBdgmVxYbcJpPCgfgyaoBQ.text: Unhappily surprised. We had a party of 5 (two big birthday celebrations) and had been to Upstream many times over the years, but not recently. Sad to say, this time was not satisfying at all and the restaurant has changed.  The appetizer cart was cute, but he didn't make it all the way around the table so some people weren't offered anything. We had the lobster bisque (called Dim Sum Bisque), which was sweet (like coconut milk with sugar added) and had no lobster flavor.  The miso soup was tasty but had huge undercooked leaves in it that were impossible to eat with a spoon. We had the mussels which were good but then, a nice broth was leftover in the bowl and not a single piece of bread for dipping.  The raw oysters were TINY (like the size of my fingertip) and pretty flavorless. We had the Hamachi appetizer, which was nothing but a fried dorsal fin with the bone detached , and a tiny piece of meat. It was flavored exactly the same as the Saki Seabass entree. The other seabass entree was similar and they were about 4 oz. of fish.  (Everything has the same flavor --coconut, lemongrass, soy, Saki, so if you order one thing, you've tasted it all). My son had the crab risotto (which must have been crab broth risotto, because there was zero crab in it). He left hungry. My daughter liked her salmon, but again, flavored the same as everything else and a tiny portion that even a 13 year old finished in 5 minutes. The halibut was thin and boring.  The sides that came with our entree was a cold vinagrette salad of some sort. We realized they had placed the sushi menu on the table, after we ordered appetizers. Waiter never mentioned it. The wine was good and the service was good, except that he insisted we stay for the "birthday treat" (small donuts) and then tried to charge us $16.00 for it. Our meal was over $400 before tip and not one of us really liked our meal. We love good seafood and we love Asian food, but this was not creative in flavors, was too skimpy on portions and way overpriced. Upstream used to be awesome. Sadly, it's off our list now.

7vTvPfJCcK26RjXALXPhJw.text: Exploring a different part of Charlotte outside of my beloved Uptown, I found myself in this cool little mini- town center and stepped into Upstream. My barber said they had "bomb" sushi so I needed to verify this, it was a strong statement.   1st, yes the sushi roll I had was amazing, full of fresh crab and ingredients, very flavorful and had the spicy kick I needed!  Must Try out: Sakura Roll - very filling. Warning: the presentation threw me off, looked like glop, I even looked over at the chef like "hmm" but I dived it and that was AMAZEBALLS! The topping WA blue crab, Sriracha sauce and some other yummiess.   2nd Must Try: sweet & sour calamari - they ate more like calamari steaks vs the thin joints we know and love. Very flavorful and great spin on calamari.   3rd, I was full after those 2 items.   Yes, it's a little pricey but guess what great sushi, nice atmosphere, totally nice for a date or friend get together and if you hit the bar b4 7pm there's 1/2 off food specials.   Bartender was pretty cool too.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sakura Roll- spicy crab
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet &amp; sour calamari

0wve0nhnNfHvgAtssTbQmA.text: I've been trying to snag a good table at Upstream on RW for the past year! Finally, I nabbed one! There was six in our party and we had a 7:30 reservation. This was the first night we had left our newborn daughter at home with a sitter and the whole ride there I was thinking "I hope this is worth it!".... Oh my gosh! It was!!!! I ordered a pineapple mojito and promptly finished it due to the fact that it was absolutely delectable!!! (And had another, of course) the RW was wonderful and extremely varied. I ordered the crab cakes and WOW! Fantastic party of flavor on my palate! Oh! SO! Good! Next was the ahi tuna on this rice cake thing--- um.... Holy smokes! Amazing!!!!! The ponzu sauce just completed it!!!!! Bryan had the flounder which was prepared perfectly over incredible risotto...... Yummy choice as well! Dessert was ok although I should have ordered a third mojito. :) truly, this restaurant is definitely a place to enjoy apps and entrees. Go grab dessert at Pinkberry's afterwards.

2ImYxRWHovU1x5iKx0RiEQ.text: Upstream has slipped... both in quality of food and service. Seems to need a 'refresh?' Once the best seafood in Charlotte, now just down right inconsistent and often mediocre. I hope you make it but I think you will need some tweaks to keep things going. Resting on your laurels?

CWjRxTVAxi7YhIobziJ1ig.text: As far as I can tell, Upstream is the best (nicest) restaurant in Charlotte, and I'm not sure it's close. Most people I've talked to tend to agree. It's just awesome: classy, hip, with great food and service. The one downside? It's super expensive, but it has every right to be, because it's outstanding. Of course, I say all this having gone there for a firm dinner, when everything was free to me. But whatever.   Great bar scene--big bar and cocktail tables for before and after your meal (or if you're there just to hang out). Super call outdoor lounge area for nice weather (definitely check this out if you're there during warmer months). Amazing dining room atmosphere--great art, great ambiance, great table stuff. Just the best.   And the food. Everything I tried was better than the rest. If you're really feeling zesty, go with their signature dish, their sea bass. It's awesome, although super expensive ($38). I gotta say, if you love fish, it's worth it. Indeed, if you're a seafood fan, this is your place. You might not love as much if you're not into seafood, although there are non-fish options should you desire them.   But if you're there, go with the fish. You will NOT be disappointed at all.   Amazing date place if you really want to impress. Or if you're just pretty loaded.

aq2rzawAaozZbk-u3rFPCw.text: We dined there for a nice evening dinner out...  seafood dishes were all tasty and well prepared.  Drink/wine service good as well.  Like the atmosphere all right.  But a restaurant is only as good as its creme brulee - or so said a rather eccentric Brit I worked with some years ago.  Theirs is made off site the prior day.  Bleech.  They're good (on all but the dessert) but they're not as good as their price.

pcaEuTe9uf5-9rcnxWgd5A.text: Been going here for years - there was a couple of years when I thought it was going downhill, but not anymore!  They just renovated the bar area - I actually liked it before and I like the renovation - it's ...softer I guess - squishy couches vs. all of the hardwood - not sure which I prefer.  Anyways, we always sit at the bar vs. the dining room area, which feels a little too formal for my liking.  The bartenders are super friendly and have good suggestions and the food here is always spectacular, in my mind.  Their sweet and sour calamari is my favorite; the raw tuna tacos were very good, but it's a small portion if you're sharing - only 3 little ones; the Queen City roll was good but has too much rice for me.  Highly recommend the tuna tuna tuna.  The Saki marinated sea bass is expensive but well worth the price.  I could bathe in the broth it comes with.  The brunch is the best I've been too - even our kids love it.     We've started getting takeout here and I was really surprised at how good it was, given takeout usually is half as good as it is in the restaurant.  Big fan!

fmKuzXlBFqlcZdDW4uMpSw.text: Came here to have dessert and coffee one evening after a big night of sushi and wine.  There were five of us and everyone got something different.  Each dessert ran around $10 and the coffee was $6.  The restaurant is very modern and hip - the wait staff seemed pleasant enough.  Looking around I could see this would be a great date place if you were looking to make an impression.  The dessert presentation was uniquely plated.  We all tasted each others desserts - they were all good...creme brulee, chocolate molten lava cake, rhubarb cobbler, ice cream cones (you get two tiny cones 2 inches tall) - and an apple martini.  Very trendy - yet casual.

cB7CH1m3xDM90DStZPpv6w.text: Seems like a restaurant that caters to corporate dinners.  Unsurprisingly, I've only been there for business related dinners.  Wait staff was friendly.  Everything I ate was good but the Sea Bass entree was especially good and the tuna appetizer stands out.

YNsVd0xEmkCKx2h-ZFxpEA.text: My boyfriend and I ate here during Restaurant Week a couple months ago and had really high expectations, based on reviews and friends' experiences. However, we were sorely disappointed. As soon as we said we'd be ordering off of the Restaurant Week menu and did not order wine, our server seemed to dismiss us and proceeded to treat us as second-class customers since we would not be ordering more expensive items. The service was extremely slow, and portions were ridiculously small. The quality of the food was mediocre, except for the dessert, which was pretty good. In addition, the ambiance was too loud to be able to have a conversation across the table. Overall, I do not recommend this restaurant and will not be returning.

oYXVJIBmR0BtDtnhwm90nQ.text: Delicious and unique seafood offerings, I had not been back in a number of years (for no particular reason), but I was quite pleased and will return again sooner!

oOeYWl6uiydFrTrkoA4J2w.text: Disappointing. Overly salted entree as well as very salty side of roasted mushrooms.

X1p4a2c9JkLDOj0RRs18Nw.text: The sea bass dish is the best! Pricey as heck but delicious! Service is always good as well. I was proposed to here, but that's not why it gets a 4, Upstream truly offers up some good stuff! Always fresh oysters and a very good menu. I don't like getting seated in the overflow room which happened on our last visit here but the bar area and main room are always pleasant to be in. Brunch is also really good!

xlASkO3aBZ0cNDRTlnZRpA.text: Must try the sea bass. This place is on the pricey side, but you will get a great meal. It is incredible.

4ly6wckeXmBSozjLCTeS0A.text: My boyfriend and I decided to go see a movie this past Sunday & wanted to grab a few appetizers before heading that way. We walked over to Upstream to check out the menu and immediately loved their options!  We headed straight for the bar where we were greeted immediately and requested two waters and two menus. About 5 minutes later we were still without waters or menus & our bartender was nowhere to be seen (there were only about 3 or 4 other people sitting at the bar)...so I had to go to the host stand to look for some.  We each ordered the lobster bisque and decided to share the sweet and sour calamari. The lobster bisque came out lukewarm which made it completely unappetizing and had one small piece of lobster in the middle that turned out to be rubbery when we went to eat it!!! We moved on to the calamari which was AMAZING and delicious!!!! Unfortunately, it was a pretty small serving for what we were paying so again we were disappointed but this time with the quantity. While dining our waters actually sat empty for pretty much the entire time the food was in front of us...very frustrating! We finally flagged down a server who was passing by to fill us up, which she did, BUT was not happy about it which she made very obvious with the annoyed long loud sigh she let out as she walked away.  Throughout our meal not a single person stopped to check and see if our food was good or if we wanted to order anything else. We were never spoken to after our order was taken and had to flag someone down to request our bill.  My boyfriend and I eat out ALL the time and usually spend somewhere between $100 - $400 for dinner each time we go out (which is at least once a week). This time we were in and out diners who were excited to test a new place for a potential new date spot...they failed completely! We can forgive soup being lukewarm or even overpaying here and there....BUT not being completely ignored like we had no place dining there because we were only ordering a few quick appetizers and water. Best of luck to other diners, we unfortunately must have come on a bad night...

GJMZzS_YybqzdiAaLwlbOg.text: Wish it had been better when I made my one and only trip.  The menu was smallish and nothing quite appealed to me.  But I know others have enjoyed it very much, maybe I am an exception.  I like the wine suggestion it was top notch.  Staff was efficient and friendly.

A0b2So_ulvKAZI5fvjETaA.text: Always excellent, service is outstanding, sushi is better than most in the city, the rosemary steak rivals the best steak houses in the city and the sweet and sour calamari appetizer is amazing. Ask about the boxes and towers if you are dining with friends as thats a great sometimes off the menu option. This is always my first call for seafood and the brunch and Sunday 1/2 price wine special is great. Its not a cheap eat but good value for money and the bar staff are excellent if you want more casual dining

7j9DagkpMBWcxJwOWhSiag.text: Great service and delicious menu.  Everything we ordered was done perfectly.  Hardest part was what or order with so many tempting recipes.  The mussels and the lobster bisque where phenomenal.  Staff was super friendly and we enjoyed having our waiter review each of the entrees and the ingredient.  Great relaxing evening.

dsBLYw8ATKofmMw6wRJCag.text: We had heard great things about this restaurant and were very excited to go.  What a disappointment.  The service was sooo slow.  I think we got water about 10 minutes after being seated. It must have taken another 10-15 minutes for the waiter to show up, and when he did, it was as if we were bothering him.  We ordered two seafood entrees, two beers, and an order of sushi.  The taste was average and the portions small.  When we ordered the sushi, we laughed at the amount we were given. For the price we were expecting more.  The atmosphere is fine - nothing special. After about 1 1/2 hours, we left $65 lighter - and still hungry. So we headed over to Dean and Deluca...

6oHQ2dAwB4DHQCoe57bn3w.text: I went there for my birthday with my wife and my mother. I wanted somewhere that you could get really good seafood. Upstream was it. The calamari they served us was some of the best Ive ever had. it was different, but completely amazing. The beer list is also very impressive. I would recommend the White Rascal if you like beer.  The entree I had was the seared ahi tuna. It is best served rare, and it comes with tempura fried green beans. The green beans have a honey balsamic coating on them as well. Let me tell you... it was one of the best things Ive eaten in my entire life, and hands down the best vegetable. I could have eating a bucket full of them. The dessert was the Carolina Blueberry tart. I inhaled it, it was amazing. All in all it was a perfect birthday meal. The service is impeccable and the establishment itself is beautiful, gorgeous. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in charlotte that is looking for upscale seafood.

P4N228f6KvX9wssCkcmNSg.text: Came here for restaurant week last July when I was visiting a friend in Charlotte. We were able to get a table outside and had a view of the shopping area. I started off with the cream of crab soup which was okay, and got the sea bass as an entree. My friend and I both thought are meals were okay, but nothing special. Service began as fine, but as the meal progressed became a little absent.

dXLPRyPgusBbytL732j4NA.text: My husband and I LOVE the atmosphere and the sushi at Upstream!  We go there on date nights, and it is perfect.  We have had a lot of sushi at a lot of different places, but no where that we have been to can top Upstream.  One of our favorites is the surf and turf roll which has steak in it as well.  All of their rolls that we have tried are exceptional...we have never had a bad roll!  In fact, the sushi is so good, that we haven't tried anything else off of their menu.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars (and I would have given it a 4 1/2 if that had been an option!!) is that their wine menu is overpriced.  There is only one Zen by the glass and it is $11!!  The cheapest wine they have by the glass is $7.  So, I never get more than one glass of wine, but it is worth it to taste that yummy sushi!!

lRVFGnuObqfk1GhlVu7F5Q.text: This past weekend my husband &  decided to give Upstream a try. We were not disappointed. We arrived early because we were unsure of parking and anticipated possible traffic issues. Traveling there led to an unanticipated road detour but we still arrived early. Parking was no issue. This was a new location for us and it was very nice, clean and well lit once t got dark. There is a movie theater there too so we figured this is a great spot for dining & taking in a movie. It was a little chilly but we noticed plenty of out door seating. We were seated for dinner shortly after arriving and we had a wonderful waiter (Greg). His opinion was spot on with the recommendations for everything from cocktails to entree. We started out with the Spicy Shrimp Lettuce Wraps. Be prepared to create your own wrap-this was fun. My husband chose to eat the shrimp and pineapple/mango/Napa cabbage separately. The flavors were great. My husband had the Surf & Turf. He enjoyed every bit of his meal. His lobster was cooked perfectly and the claw meat was removed for easy eating. We eat out quite a bit with steaks being my husband's choice for his meal. He ranked his American Wagyu Flank Steak as 2nd best ever. His Surf & Turf had equality great accompaniments. I got the Sake Marinated Wild Sea Bass...MmmMmm Good. In looking at the meal I thought it would never fill me up. Oh boy was I wrong. This dinner  was delectable. Not a heavy meal but filling. I was able to have desert afterwards. Everything on the menu looked outstanding. I am not a sushi person so I would not try it but the reviews are good. Oh I didn't mention the cocktails. These were real drinks. It is so disappointing to get a cocktail that is supposed to have alcohol but gets watered down-this was not the case. I would love to return for their brunch because this would be more of a sampling of the chef's creations. The bill was not the highest we've ever spent but it was up there. I read some of the other reviews and I'd say that this place is upscale so be prepared to dine well & pay well.

oO_FjEj4iCq8GfYpAQjKDw.text: Upstream is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. It is nice to get away from all the cookie-cutter chains and go somewhere different like Upstream with amazing, fresh food.

UgxT4mStBKiJkZu4ytGNyQ.text: I've been here several times, the food is fantastic, but the service is often terrible. They tend to be pretty inattentive and have at times been rude. They do have probably the best brunch in Charlotte, which is just about all I go there for anymore - it's $25 for a full buffet with a wide range of dishes.

pHaOCCFhWMDQ80U1u6Afhw.text: This is always a go-to spot when we visit Charlotte. If you're lucky you'll catch it on a night when Greg Crawford is working the bar. He has a great attitude and makes his customers feel so welcome. Great sushi and cocktails and brunch, too!

JbAzXjAl5OpYon6vb77oNg.text: We had the signature sea bass dish which was amazing! The service was lacking but we would be willing to give this place another try!

8nSOfynzxhGM1MmCbPar0A.text: Huge fan! Lots of room to sit, comfortable environment and the food is incredible. When I went last night, we sat at the bar for a little while and ordered sliders, muscles and sushi-- Being a pescatarian, I ate and loved the muscles and sushi. I've also been with my family another time where we have gotten shrimp and fried oysters as an appetizer and those were delicious as well. For dinner I enjoyed the salmon- it was grilled perfectly and everyone around the table enjoyed their meals as well. This is a definte thumbs up place and perfect for date night, birthdays, family dinners or when you just want a nice but comfortable place to have dinner!

c-nwWKUkXjjxJQmloi_OqA.text: I've been to Upstream many times.  I've had some excellent meals there, with some perfectly prepared seafoods.  I love their mussel appetizer  which is served in a cast iron pot and is enough to share 2 or even 4 ways as appetizers, but is also plenty for a main course if you like.   Service can be mediocre and slow at times, as it was at a recent lunch there.  That won't stop me from returning, but it would be nice if the service was equal to the food.

j3VZRr0JJ4gUBtULTUSjHQ.text: I had the pleasure of hosting a corporate event here. The venue, the food, and the service were excellent. I look forward to hosting more events and dining here in the future. Best restaurant in Charlotte by far!!!

um54f6wGkWw1xswOIfde-w.text: I came to Charlotte on a business trip and checked out yelp and picked this restaurant.  I had a reservation for 7:30 but was not seated till 8:05.  I ordered the lobster and it was not fresh.  The server was fantastic but not the lady in the front.  Horrible customer service and just gave me this attitude.  Whatever, this is the last time I am coming to this place even on my next trip.  The 3 star is for the appetizer and the server's excellent service.

NudNcsjYYgJHbvyy3j1Fdg.text: Go on Half Priced Bottle night! I went one night with a friend and had a bottle of Elyse "Korte Ranch" Zin for $35!!! I wanted to take one home, but didnt have the guts. Sushi is always enjoyable, even though it is no longer being prepared at the sushi bar. The Executive Chef, Scott Wallen is super talented and has a great staff in the kitchen, pressing out dishes that just work! Wine list is good, although, at one time a much more "Seafood Friendly" one that has now given way to the big names. Service is always good, but if you really want to have a good time, sit in the bar area! If I could give Upstream a 4.5, I would!

8DCY2X9xVfLf_bVI90Cf1Q.text: While in Charlotte for business we ventured to upstream for dinner.   My company was awkward, at best. Two gentlemen, the closest 30 years my senior who are business associates. But the guys wanted fish so I went along for the ride.   First impression - I liked the outdoor seating area.. it looked like a fun place to grab apps and wine with friends, but that wasn't my fate on this particular night.   Instead, we were seated in a booth, in the back of the restaurant. Yay.  On to the food: We shared an assortment of sushi and sashimi off of the sushi menu. I'm a sushi snob so everything was pretty mediocre. But to my associates, apparently it was great considering they didn't say two words during this course.   On to our mains - as a west coaster, generally 4pm is not my dinnertime so I went light: the Gazpacho was slightly spicy, flavorful and the dollop of creme freche was the perfect topper. Unfortunately my second course, a melon salad with some sort of duck bacon didn't make the grade. Boring, blech, nothing impressive. The dishes my fellow diners ate looked good, but I really can't comment any further.   Even by LA standards, this meal seemed pretty pricey and not particularly outstanding.

9LRk_k_O9BVMiw2FViypfQ.text: To be fair, I generally stay as far away from swanky Southpark as possible except for an occasional trip to Earthfare. However restaurant week and the meat-eater's friend being a chef at Upstream led us to visit this week. We showed up around 7:30 during restaurant week, expecting a bit of a wait. The hostess was very pleasant and offered seating outside on the patio right away or suggested a drink in the bar while we waited. We chose the bar.   This seems to be more of an older 50+ crowd with a few exceptions. Mostly business casual attire but I didn't feel out of place in dressed up jeans. The decor is traditional Southpark - dark woods and colors.   The bartender greeted us promptly, presented the wine list and gave us a few minutes to decide. They have an extensive (and pricey) wine list and a handful of specialty cocktails and martinis. Drinks were served and that was the extent of our bartender interaction. He seemed to get in the weeds a bit with all the server orders coming in. Not a big issue as we didn't really need anything else but could be a problem if we were trying to order at the bar.    Our wait was as promised - approximately thirty minutes. The dining room is a bit smaller than I anticipated but nicely laid out. You have a glimpse at the open kitchen but not enough to gawk during your whole meal and enough privacy at the tables and booths that you don't hear your neighbors' conversations. Our server greeted us, got our new drink order and came back to discuss the special. I must admit, I enjoyed freaking him out by dropping the "I'm a vegan" on him. I doubt this is a normal request at Upstream and I wouldn't dream of showing up without advance warning (which we'd done via the friend).  He consulted with the kitchen and came back looking much more relaxed and surprised with how easy it would be to accommodate me. I had the Shaved Athena Melon salad sans ham, tomato risotto sans cheese and a lovely sorbet sampler with warmed peaches. The sorbet, while really good, isn't made in house. Meat-eater had the Smoked Cod Cake and Lobster cakes, Snake River Ranch Wagyu Flank Steak and French Macaroons. He's still talking about the cod and lobster cakes and how good they were.  I really enjoyed all my courses. The salad did need a little "oomph" to make up for the lack of salty ham but overall very happy with our meals.   I was impressed with the service. Our plates were removed quickly, our server was present in the dining room but not in the way, courses were served promptly and glasses kept full.   Upstream isn't my normal type of preferred dining or cuisine but I appreciate any place that has excellent service and chefs that know their food and are willing to make accommodations in a gracious manner for special diets.  I know Upstream is part of the Harper's Group but I thought it had enough personality to not be classified "just another corporate place".

7RL_sx1r_Rs4PiJS4GKSfA.text: I've been to Upstream three times, spanning a period of around five years.  The first meal we had there was excellent -- service and food were unquestionably outstanding.  Around a year later, we returned for another dinner and this time it was underwhelming.  The food was OK, but when you're spending $200+ for two people you expect an exceptional experience.  Around a month ago, on the advice of a friend, I went for Sunday brunch.  It wasn't the first time I had heard about the great brunch there, so I was anticipating something special.  We arrived around 12:30 and ordered a couple of mimosas.  What they served us was orange juice with a splash of champagne.  We began with a selection of small plates.  I was most excited about the crabcake benedict, but I needn't have been.  Aside from being ridiculously small (it was truly more of an amuse bouche) -- the dish was bereft of flavor.  French toast was similarly disappointing.  So off to the buffet.  We should have checked its condition before we sat down.  It looked like a war zone.  Mid range hotel chains do a much better job of maintaining their buffets better than Upstream.  What was once a smoked salmon fillet was now a ravaged pile of flesh.  There were bits of food and trash around almost every station.  They were out of most of the premium items:  the salmon, crab legs and crab claws and sushi (which I probably wouldn't have eaten from a buffet anyway, but nevertheless...)  I ended up with an omelet -- it seemed safe, although expensive at $25.  All in all a big disappointment.

g_0d5jsQZTG9xYmKDXbJlw.text: Upstream has gone downhill, fast. While the bar ambience and feel is still awesome, the sushi in particular was extremely lacking. Spicy Tuna rolls were not fresh and smelled like fish. California rolls lacked flavor and were quite bland.   Service was also not particularly good and there was a very creepy manager who put us off.   It is a shame because Upstream has been a staple of the South Park area for years, but their sushi quality is completely lacking these days. I cannot comment on the main courses as we did not have any.

kTdcLMdky_HVZhTkRCO3mg.text: Love the high quality tuna and fresh oysters.  The staff is super accommodating, friendly, and efficient without being over-bearing.  Clean and classy.  One of the best restaurants in Charlotte!

4Dt6yzl878Jd0wsaATa0fQ.text: Their Sunday brunch is awesome. Never leave unsatisfied or hungry. They had the freshest oysters today - along with elegant other dishes that begged going back for more. We never are disappointed here.

ORprH9ADJawyFp-HGo2s3g.text: Back when I lived in Charlotte....  Let me start by saying I am not a big seafood fan. I enjoy it but not a must have on my list of foods. I think it has to do with that type of food. Done well it is fantastic and not it is pathetic.   Upstream does a great job with the seafood. It has a bit of a modern feel to the place and you can feel a bit underdressed if you show up in some casual clothing for dinner but lunch is fine for it. I had the NC Trout which was very tasty whenever I would go there. The Lobster Bisque is awesome. The portions about right and prices on par for a place of this class. It is a good place to people watch. Once caught Chriss Issak there when he was in town for a concert.

WmLekB5odh-3H1oZVLX1rw.text: Upstream is probably thought of as one of the best restaurants in Charlotte.  I am from Philadelphia where there are excellent restaurants with iron chefs so my viewpoint may be a bit skewed.   The food was good but not great or amazing.  Every dish (except the house salad) was over salted.  My husband had the tuna and I had the seabass. They were both very good but as I said before not great.  We would go there again but for sushi/raw items not necessarily the cooked menu items.  The salad was was the highlight for me (house salad) and the crab bisque was pretty tasty too.   Overall the service was very good but slow.  Our waiter was one of the most knowledgeable wait staff we have encountered since moving from PA.

GFTcBZzCsyMwu9mC8v6-pg.text: Went there last Sunday night for a special occasion. It wasn't very busy and we were seated right away. The waitress was excellent and knew the menu very well.  The manager also stopped by a couple times to check on us.  I had the noodle bowl with scallops, shrimp, etc. it was very good.  My wife and daughter shared the rib eye which was big enough for 2.  That was good too. Other members of the group had fish and everyone enjoyed their meals. Don't have anything negative to say about the place. For me it is a special occasion place but it is not as expensive as a high end steak house   It was my second time there and I will return.

xQcMVv1FXv7FSntUGd0XYg.text: Thought Upstream was a delight. Our waitress was excellent. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and her timing was perfect. She was very attentive but did not hover. The food was fresh and delicious. The crab cakes are full of real crab, not bread or fillers. The sea bass is a must try as is the sushi. Nice atmosphere. We went on a weeknight. Almost all the tables were full but the restaurant wasn't noisy.  My only disappointment was that the entree portions were a tad small for the men in our party so maybe I should deduct 1/2 star. I won't just because everything else was perfection.

JzkNFsJXpuqwngul79SHXA.text: Upstream has a new menu, which was disappointing since I finally made it out there just to eat the grilled octopus and sea bass entree to find neither on the new menu. However everything we tried was phenomenal and our waitress was amazing and I can't wait to go back!   The new menu is cheaper and smaller portions than the old menu (think entrees in the 20s vs 30s) and has a variety of small plates. I had my first sample of Hamachi and fell in love! We also ordered "the rock" which is steak that you cook at your table on, you guessed it, a hot rock. The rock was a fun experience but the steak was difficult to pry off so I doubt we would order it again. The real star of the whole night was the sea bass appetizer that came steamed in a bag with an outstanding sauce. I couldn't begin to tell you what was in the sauce but I can say it took a bit of willpower not to lick the remainder up after the fish was finished.   My main was the steamed bronzini with baby bok choy. It was served with a ponzu sauce and the thinnest sliced scallion on top. I liked it but wasn't as wowed as I was with the appetizers. However it was steamed fish so there's a naturally built in excitement level. My fiance ordered the halibut that I was considering and it was served with some outstanding curried mashed potato. The curried mashed potato was a unique and creamy flavor that we will work to recreate immediately.   Our service was some of the best we've had in Charlotte. Our waitress knew the new menu confidentially and answered all our questions without looking at any notes. My wine glass never quite got to empty and neither did my water. She was around a bit in the beginning as we made choices but stayed away (other than refills) to let us enjoy the dinner. All of our dishes came out quickly and piping hot from the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sea bass - may not be beautiful but I promise it is amazing.

EQ1NWnsS5wIt_kur8BHbFA.text: Late post: went for Easter brunch and it was delicious! This is our 2nd year there and will definitely be back for a third year! Unlimited oysters, unlimited peel and eat shrimp...Prime Rib, Roasted lamb, broccoli and cheese casserole...Asian style chicken wings and drummettes. It was pretty awesome! Oh if you love sweets...you won't be disappointed. I wish they did this brunch more than just Easter! I enjoy Upstream and especially their upscale brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Easter brunch at Upstream...everything was great!
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

XkeXHG_5zIun3UlXtGaxMA.text: We tried this place randomly for lunch yesterday. I had heard that it was an excellent seafood place, but I have to admit, I was slightly disappointed.   Upon being seated, we were informed of the new lunch menu...well, it's an extremely restrictive menu. It's basically all sushi at this point, so if you don't like sushi, you're screwed. (I do love sushi, fortunately, but my wife was recovering from a sore throat and would have appreciated different options.)   My edamame was completely unsalted, and since this is one of those "I know better than you do" places, there wasn't salt on the table. I find it super annoying to have to ask for basic condiments like salt and pepper. It's a bit condescending.   I had the Snap, Crackle, and Pop roll, which was quite good. The unagi (eel) nigiri was decent. I've honestly had better unagi, though.   Service was great--our waiter was nice and attentive.   I'd like to try this place again for dinner, but if I'm looking for sushi in the CLT, there are spots I enjoy more.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

_-Z0lyGNvlF3XrsZZf5QaA.text: The sea bass was good but the portion was very small. The calamari was mediocre and not very filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. $13 Calamari
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. $39 Sea bass

lEld0_9r1geCQNV18uqM4A.text: Sushi was sub par. Service was lacking. We asked for things several times and they forgot or came out 10 minutes later to say it would be a while.  No bread until it was requested, didnt fill the water glasses, ask for coffee or dessert.   We did sit at the bar are with a birthday party but the restaurant was not busy at all. We asked for dessert for the bday girl, took long and came out cold.  Sorry didn't have a better experience.

Tu8oB3fuzYANKmMGl15WEQ.text: I'm not one to post, but today's experience caught me off guard.   - Food was ok.  - Drinks were good. - Waitress Ashley was great. - Hostess, didn't get her name, was good.  - Andy, had me livid. Profiler? Did we not meet your expectations as guest? Did we need a haircut? A Suit?  Andy I think helps supervise the local or something, not so much a fan. Why? Let me tell you.   - Jovanni and I out and about, going to the movies close by, but wanted to eat something nice. - I was outside looking at the menu.  - Jovanni enters to get a table. (Jovanni is Guatemalan/Mex, darker skin tone wearing a windbreaker like top) - Host asked him for a name and how many to get us queue, there was no one ahead of him. - ANDY, a mgr or sup, came from behind host and said reservations only to him. - Jovanni came out and said they did not have availability. - Out of frustration, I call (FROM OUTSIDE) to check availability for a table. - Host was cool/good energy on the phone and said we close at ten and have availability now.   Stumped!!! I know, I was too.   - I go in, have Jovanni wait outside. - Table is available, yes no wait.  - Go get Jovanni, Andy's eyes wide open. - We go to table.  Jovanni did not want to go back, I made him. He was so uncomfortable. I felt bad after for him. There was a few stares it felt like from Andy. Jovanni is still talking about it and is wondering how we got different response to availability.  Just creating awareness!!!!!

_BSf6ragW8j2QdCf1Bhz2Q.text: Enjoyed a very fine dining experience with my dear friend during restaurant week. Our waiter, Greg, was very hospitable and helped persuade appetizer decision from soup to salad. First, we had two kinds of warm bread with marinated olive oil.  My meal started with the Tega Hills salad which was both crisp (lettuce), sweet (pecans), and creamy (brie). Then I enjoyed the salmon with peanuts, arugula, and pureed parsnips. The surprisingly odd pairing peanuts and parsnips was unexpectedly delicious and creamy with sweet undertones. The salmon was crisy on the outside and tender on the inside! Lastly, I had the chocolate ganache with cherries and coconut gelato. I loved the gelato, but for me the ganache was too rich.  My friend chose the crab cake with pickled veggies and absolutely loved it. Next, she had filet mignon with mashed potatoes and shaved, grilled brussel sprouts. I tried the brussels and they were very tasty: flavorful exterior and creamy, melt in your mouth interior. Lastly, she had the apple pie crisp with caramel whisky gelato. I especially like the cinnamon flavor of the crisp, the gelato was a strong flavor but was a nice balance for the crisp which tasted more like cake than pie.  The ambience and decor was very nice. Upstream is a nice upscale restaurant great for date night, business dinner or family milestone celebrations. Restaurant Week with friends is a great way to try the restaurant without completely blowing your budget or breaking the bank. Our meal including tip was almost $90, however during a regular day it very well could have exceeded $150 as many entrees are easily $35 alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Artwork
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apple crisp with caramel whiskey gelato
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet mignon, mashed taters &amp; grilled brussels

-0N_rdgmqm1B1FKdQmVrmQ.text: A very disappointing dinner experience. This used to be a very good seafood restaurant for years. No more. The service is good. Attentive but the food was over priced and not that tasty. The menu changed over with the new CPCC Charlotte chef Gene Cato a few months ago. The calamari appetizer used to be fantastic and now tastes like a fast food place. Lots of breading. Butter lettuce salad was so sad looking. The halibut I had was served with leeks I think but which were very tough.  True it's a Tuesday night so not much business but I feel like it's in a spiral. Would not recommend and don't plan to return any time soon. Even bonefish is better ... sorry Tom Sasser I enjoy your restaurants usually but not this time.

h3VES2FahDq23yQ8wgq9Sw.text: As always an awesome time out with my Bookclub sisters. We were short in numbers but we had a blast. Good food, convo, and  fellowship. Had a nice corner table. We had 2 to order the salmon,  two ordered the filet and my bestie ordered the lobster. Lobster was a little over cooked per my bestie but everyone loved the crab croquettes. Calamari and the slaw that came with it was great. We participated in the restaurant week deal, wonderful Jennifer our waitress let 4 of us substitute our desserts for two appetizers. Most had the calamari and crab croquettes. Everything was great, love the location relaxed atmosphere and fast service. Reservations was at 6. Seated 3 of us a little early. Prompt service, no waiting, and complimentary valet no worries on parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

UZVwPo_s_rFdJDKzPOOy3g.text: Still a great place for lunch and their coffee cups now work for left handed folks. I had their steak over rice with a coddled egg on top. I  do not know how they seasoned it but it was spicy but so spicy that you lost the flavor; excellent. The have some of the best french fries but if you order a sandwhich skip the fries and get the brssel sprout side. it is great. I do not know what they do to the olive oil that is served with the bread but it is the best. It taste like you imagine a fresh olive might taste like picked off of the tree. While there i saw that they served weekday breakfast 7 - 10 AM so this morning I went back to try them out. At 8:45 AM this morning. doors open and after two loud "hello" and no one to be seen, I left and went to renaissance in small shops at South Park where I had the best French pastries in Charlotte.

AxIG0T7QTXkgbOwKcAOKdQ.text: Love.  Love the brunch.  Super relaxed atmosphere. Really nice people.    The menu has unique items on it for the foodie in is all, and tried-and-True-all-time favorites.  The bacon is really yummy as are the pancakes.   Five stars.  Can't wait to go back!

Sbfml25j3UZphdkfkOpYoQ.text: Lack of service with reservation as well. Food was not enjoyable or fresh as described for an upscale restraunt expected more than was given will definitely consider another place for the next meal.

4tl89vttAcQdRKJbz3ctIA.text: My boyfriend and I went here during restaurant week. Needed to make reservations, only slot was 5:30. Hostesses were nice, seated in five minutes. The servers were dressed in a white chef attire. "90's attire as they call it". You can see the whole kitchen and chefs cooking through glass panel. More upscale seafood restrains this; nice  and elegant. Had a big menu for restaurant week; great seafood for the price of $35. Included the appetizer, main course and dessert. We ordered the calamari and roasted oysters and were definitely great. Enjoyed the sake marinated sea bass a lot. The tuna was good too; served with book Choy and crispy rice! For dessert we had tiramisu with banana rum and Creme brulee! Definitely will be back for tiramisu. Our server was great with helping us decide what to get on the menu. She was very attentive even when it started to get reallllyyy busy. I loved our experience here and definitely will come back. Wouldn't have came here if it wasn't for restaurant week or special events because it's a bit pricey. But DEFINITELY worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

mdwf6z5lxaG5YBHYE8IxHw.text: Chose this restaurant for Queens Feast restaurant week. Most restaurants use a limited menu for this event but Upstream uses their regular menu and adjusts the prices accordingly.  We had a reservation but arrived early and were seated immediately. The service staff was excellent, very professional, very knowledgeable, very helpful with questions about the menu. The food was prompt, we had appetizers, main course, and desserts. Everything was excellent! I can't remember the last time that I had meal that was this delicious!

RcEt8WGxLPUXRg1ObaqQQg.text: Amazing restaurant with fantastic service! Made our special celebration dinner a wonderful experience.

j5tV7TYH9Wb9Ds0FYPLg0Q.text: This place never disappoints! I went here last night for restaurant week and it was excellent. They use their regular menu and offer and of the item for 3 courses at $35. There are some items that have an upcharge but I very much enjoyed the menu that was a set price. For $35, I had the sweet corn bisque, the 1lb lobster and the peach and blueberry crumble with ice cream. We also enjoyed the $15 wine pairing with each course. I cannot say enough about the soup and lobster. One pound was definitely enough with the salad and potatoes. The lobster was so luxurious that it felt like I was eating cake for dinner. Our waitress was delightful and did a great job pairing the appropriate wine with each course. We had an excellent time and I would recommend this for restaurant week every time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1lb lobster

mBsQ9IWAv1O0ucMvAkEzdg.text: I went with a group of friends for restaurant week.  The service was great (especially for restaurant week). They brought us bread with infused olive oil which was great. They were offering half off Lamarca prosecco making it $17 (a little overpriced for grocery store prosecco), but we still got it.  For Queens fest you got to pick an appetizer, an entree, and a dessert.  I got sweet and sour calamari and it was pretty good, it would have tasted a lot better if the breading was crispier, it was kind of mushy, but the flavoring was great and I have never had sweet and sour calamari before so it was a really cool concept.  Next I got my entree, I got the filet which came with a piece of grilled romaine.  This meal was pretty terrible. The filet tasted like Salisbury steak, it tasted like they just took the filet out of a can, I know they didn't but the flavor was terrible, the others at the table agreed who got the filet.  The piece of Romaine I hope was just for decoration because it was awful. (I have had a great grilled romaine Caesar salad in the past so this wasn't a new thing for me).  I got the chocolate indulgence for dessert and it was good, it was pretty rich, so a couple people who got it in our group couldn't finish it.  It had Oreo crust which I couldn't tell since it wasn't crispy like your typical Oreo crust desserts, but that wasn't a concern, it was still pretty good.  The food was decent here but the steak was a big let down, hopefully it's just because of restaurant week.

lwaz7ZQSHs-q3LUPimw6KA.text: Excellent menu!  I have taken several clients there, Germans included and they have all been very impressed with the menu and the atmosphere of the restaurant.  The seafood is excellent and they always have creative plating techniques.  It's gourmet so there is the small portions but I have never left hungry.  Gotta be in the QC's top 10!

faGdWB4jgEvXTzYuF11NjA.text: "Sweet and Sour Calamari & Sake Marinated Seabass". I was a bit disappointed with the food. I understand the Asian twist on the calamari, but the sauce buries the natural flavor. The sauce was not sweet and more bitter than sour.  A dip or drizzle would have been a better choice.  The seabass broth was too salty. The server poured the entire serving into the bowl, so it was difficult to control the broth.  The seabass was very firm and the lobster dumplings less than spectacular.  Overall I was not impressed, especially considering the price.  I may have better luck with the sushi.

u5uBaQ7-sjSSXnixQf79Ig.text: Wow, what happened? I've been enjoying this restaurant since it opened. Went in tonight and was not impressed. The menu has been cut back and many of my favorites are gone.  I was told there is a new chef. I think it's better to say there is a new restaurant and I'm not impressed. Very sad to have to write this review.

qCG4Q6DWc6f2dfsa_ti3dQ.text: Upstream is conveniently located in Phillips Place. I went there on a late Sunday afternoon. I had a nice time and didn't break the bank.   They have great happy hour from 4-7pm each day (although you have to sit in the bar). Select sushi rolls and appetizers are half price and on Sunday they have half price glasses of wine. I think that they have a different drink special each day.  The service was very good and friendly! We sat for quite a while visiting, sipping on wine, and eating and we never felt rushed or that we were taking up too much space and time. The sushi was good (although I didn't care for their version of spicy tuna roll) and they had a nice happy hour variety. I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It's a good place for a relaxing happy hour!

fG8AOb3Cn0L6YEgOYYmnRw.text: I went here for lunch time.  Restaurant Feel - Romantic. The ceiling is pretty intriguing.   Service - Timely, the waitress is very nice and respectful.   Food Quality - I ordered 2 oysters. One from the East and One from the West. The one from the west coast wasn't that great =T. The one from the east was very sweet, as fresh seafood should be. I tried the bisque, which was pretty tasty. I also had the fish and chips, which was pretty nice. Crunchy, flaky batter, delicious fish. Very nice.

cs1tJiLSRVsrKkyWunvelQ.text: This place is a total disappointment. Not close to being worthy of the prices they charge both food and drink and to top it off, the waitress was constantly rushing us. Will not return.

ypkPlkwdIK-nbrRv3PN-nQ.text: This place by far has the best and freshest seafood in town. I love their Sunday Brunch, so much to choose from!  The manager Ken is extremely nice and makes you feel like a vip. I saw him handle a difficult customer with grace and ease.  They have great patio seating on warmer days with great cocktails and appetizers.  They recently remodeled the bar area and it looks beautiful.  They even offer cooking classes! One of my favorites in Charlotte by far.

c36KMuuItJ42ICdDxFPvBw.text: By far the best oysters I ever had!!! We drove across town from Lake Norman to Phillips Place searching for the best oysters in town and we found it here. I had a friend from NYC flying in for the holidays. We did a take out of 4 dozen blue point oysters for 3 people and it was worth the drive across town just to get them. Every single oysters were nicely packed on ice for the 40 minutes ride home. It was the most delicate and careful driving with the freshest oysters in the back seats. What a trip! We were so happy we finally made it home to try the best oysters available in town. The next time I would love to dine in and try your other seafood entrees.   The manager and the hostesses were very nice and friendly.

sEeFkjAUKVjq8Y8LUL10yQ.text: It was ok. Parts were good. The sea bass was ok the crab cakes were very good.   I still prefer the bone fish grill. They had great service.

3TKeO4jZi7DLnLVtRelpXA.text: Gave the restaurant a second shot - equally disappointed.  Bar service was slow, 45 minutes to get an appetizer from an inattentive waitress.  Once at our table, we watched our salads walk around the restaurant twice before the server found our table.  Waiter served the entrees and walked away, never checked to see how our meal was.  While tasty, the portions are small.  Unfortunately, the best part of this restaurant is the valet service.  Don't frustrate yourself, dine elsewhere with friends.

RRr15mIXS7cmKHs2ahWwgw.text: Perfect for special occasions! A really nice place for fine dining and having a celebration with your love one.

xej52MFzlifOE7r_SEjMZQ.text: I went to Upstream on a Friday evening immediately after work (5:30'ish). The decor is excellent and romantic. I decided to sit at the bar and I have to say that the wait staff was so very pleasant and attentive. After my guest arrived we were given the open to sit at a table. The staff was very familiar with the wine selection and menu. I had the all natural chicken breast which was by far the best chicken breast I have ever had. The only small setback was that I'm a 30 years old energetic, fun loving female, and most of the patronages were 50+ and a bit snooty ( I say this do to the way some were addressing the wait staff...). Perhaps the time of day that I went played a role in the type of crowd I was amongst. However, I would go again, since the food was excellent.

kZwCfYVFfh9vVjniOWVQlg.text: This is definitely one of the pricier restaurants I've ever been to in Charlotte, but that's not saying much. The food is definitely pretty good, with some odd menu items, but they really shocked me with how much flavor they had.  The ambiance of the place wasn't too much to my liking, with so many different plates, silverware options, etc...but I'm sure if you're used to this than it's no different than any pricey restaurant. Heck, the waiter even poured the wine for my girlfriend & had her try it before buying (which is apparently customary)...  It is in a nice area of Charlotte, close enough to the hustle & bustle but just far enough away. The food, while not top notch, is pretty good & it sure is a nice place to impress a date, but make sure you bring your credit card.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside waiting area
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance

bqrsokbmQ5DeHTqykxWMrA.text: I enjoyed a three course Valentine's Weekend dinner with my boyfriend and I loved it! Lobster bisque, salmon and dessert were all wonderful. The service is lovely. When someone walks by and simply straightens a fork on your table for you-that tells me that someone is paying attention to me. I would love to go here again.

YYPzT0_i5sH9_id5CaVPBQ.text: Upstream is a great location for fresh seafood. I have been to this restaurant during summer restaurant week and they had this amazing salmon on a cedar plank with a peach chutney to talk about for days. I have also enjoyed their fresh sushi. Great place to relax and have a glass of wine out on their patio too. I've never been disappointed.

z--ptoSRreC4gAuhetzVUA.text: Upstream is one of 3 main restaurants in Phillips Place (PF Chang's & The Palm are the other two). Known for it's seafood and brunch, I've been here several times for dinner or some quick bites at the bar. For me, a solid 3 stars. I've never tried the brunch, but heard it's very good. Same ownership group as Zink & Mimosa Grill.  For dinner...I've had the tuna and the scallops. Both were good, and the portions were not too far off from their $25-$30 entree price. Both times I've been there for dinner, we've sat on the patio which is nice and a great view the end of Phillips place near the movie theater. There are some lounge chairs outside near the front as well, which seem a little off placed for me, but it's a nice tough. They have valet parking too.   I've been here more for a quick stop for sushi and oysters with a beer at the bar. There are a few TV's around, so fellas, if the lady(ies) are shopping, go here for a beer and some apps...you'll be able to catch the game in the bar area. Sushi was average to me, but the oysters were good and when I think Upstream, I think of a good oyster spot for me in the South Park area.   I've never had a problem with service and would recommend Upstream to try. For me, I need to still try the brunch!

xPKwlkRLRlGZyRUrOUYMvA.text: I've been so pleased when I've eaten here.  They food is prepared so well and seems fresh.  I love the waitstaff attire.  It really makes me feel like I have my own personal chef coming to the table.  The servers we have had are always professional & courteous & they & the kitchen are most gracious in altering to our tastes.  They even allowed me to order a favorite dinner entree that wasn't on the lunch menu.  I normally don't care for open kitchens, but even being seated at the nearest table to the kitchen it is unobstrusive!  I usually like booth seating, but really the center tables are the best ones & especially if you want to see and be seen.  The decor is very relaxing which I enjoy.  I also enjoy that the diners that come in for the most part seem to enjoy maintaining the intimate feel of the restaurant and are not overly loud (or don't feel the need to be since the noise level of the restaurant itself is fairly calm)

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

MvJxqpCYpI6QxoG4ahicYg.text: The food as fresh as it can get.  The black bass was caught that morning!   The chef prepares the most beautiful presentation and uses the most unique spices to make for a great experience.  The  decor didn't quite make sense to me and they could use someone to put together a cohesive theme for the place.  Reguardless, I will be back.

PI8wE5PzvlQJTx1EktrCqA.text: My first time eating here and my first time eating out since having to switch to a dairy and gluten free diet. Our waiter (I think his name was Matt) was extremely sweet and helpful in fact we actually got to the restaurant before they opened and they still sat us! The chefs were accommodating to my diet and happy to do so. I will be back and recommend it to everyone! I had the rock shrimp pad Thai and it was fantastic and a giant portion. My mother had the shrimp burger special and said it was perfect. Bravo what a great place with perfectly polite service!

2HQWtSaQa3KWEYjSjAQ-1g.text: Great Restaurant.  They have the best calamari in town!     Excellent service and great atmosphere.  Try the bar menu from 5-7pm where you can sample the best of everything!

KHphUUvVd53Yvv9eH6a7UA.text: Upstream is a really nice place to dine. When my wife and I moved to Charlotte last year this is one of the first restaurants that we found that satisfied our seafood craving. A year later and this is by far the BEST seafood that we've found. We've been here 4 or 5 times in the past year. The seafood, sushi and steak (and the mussels) were all great. But we really really love the Costa Rican Chocolate dessert. It's excellent. The waitstaff is terrific. Very informative, attentive and friendly. It's a nice place for a date. It also has a really nice outdoor seating area to hang out and have a few drinks, appetizers or desserts. The only thing that I probably wish would change is the bar. It's quite spacious and seems to have a nice selection of beer and wine. I just didn't really enjoy the atmosphere of it. It seemed to be more appealing to an older crowd. But ironically they're in the middle of renovating the bar area quite a bit, so I might have to update this review again in a few months.   I would definitely recommend Upstream for a nice meal, just don't forget the dessert!

-WQ7srm1YqjxNxMgRG_GQA.text: Coming from Boston, we have sort of high expectations for seafood. My husband ordered Sea Bass and I, the Grouper, and it was perfectly cooked and delicious. Our server was extremely friendly and gave us his honest feedback of not only his favorite dishes, but of almost every single thing on the menu. They also have a very nice wine selection (we are big fans of Burgundy whites). We left with very happy bellies and had a wonderful time! It does however, seem to be a bit overpriced.

G-4G7yKq1NLLi-UcXQW9tA.text: Came here for lunch on Saturday.  This is a review of the Grilled Angus Burger only.  Hot d*mn, you must order this delicious piece of meat.  "A burger at an upscale seafood restaurant?" you might ask? So did I.  I felt like I had just found the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.  It comes with smoked gouda, fried egg (cooked perfectly), and with the crunchiest, most delicious fries I have ever eaten.   Get it, get it, get it!

OjtcVWaTgrAwmIHjYlyX7g.text: Have no idea why the reviews are not stellar. My wife, son, and daughter in law ate dinner there a month ago, and the food, atmosphere and service were all some of the best we've ever had. And we're globe-travelling gourmands who've had some of the best this world has to offer, at any price. We had Thanksgiving dinner there last year, and a couple of years prior. Same all times.  It's not inexpensive, but it's an experience worth every penny.

OUOvuupiXWjz86rS9ANaKQ.text: We checked out Upstream for Restaurant Week and had an okay experience. We were sat at the table where everyone comes and goes from the kitchen while the restaurant was maybe 1/2 full - felt like worst seat in the house with just two of us having both our chairs bumped or kicked as staff flew by.   Cocktails were excellent - Old Fashioned and the watermelon margarita.  My girlfriend loved her seafood dishes. Even for restaurant week, she was given a heaping pile of mussels that she raved over. She also liked the salmon, but wasn't thrilled with being told that the temperature she should order left the salmon practically raw. I ordered the wagyu flank steak which also couldn't be ordered above mid-rare (tried twice to order it medium or medium rare). Even at the temp they suggested, the meat lacked any flavor. This was made up for by the onions and potatoes which were delicious.  Desserts were also incredible! Cheesecake and Cherry Crisp.  Overall, good restaurant week spot if you're into seafood. Don't go if you're not. Would have been really disappointed to have walked out of there with a $150+ tab.   Dining experience: 3.5/10 Drinks: 8/10 Food: 6/10

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels app
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Old fashioned &amp; watermelon margarita
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon

PAVZpst5sSULUYCtkgbU2Q.text: I have been wanting to try their bunch since I read about it on Charlotte Agenda. I wanted to like it so badly. The menu looked great.   The tasting menu changed since I first saw it, but a lot of the same things were on it still, just a few things that I wanted to try were gone. The price also increased to $30 per person.   We tried most of the menu which included: Sweet and Sour Calamari, Korean Fried Chicken Lettuce Wraps, Virginia Country Ham Bao Buns, Roasted Meatballs, Walnut Pumpkin Pancakes, Curried Deviled Eggs, Country Ham and Pimiento Cheese Biscuit, Pork Belly Benedict, Upstream Slider, and the Roast of the Day.  The best of the food was just ok, but some of it was really bad. The one thing I really liked were the Bao buns, but when we got a second order of them they were not cooked and my husband's tasted like bleach. My favorite thing was the coffee cake they gave you to start the meal.   You can order two plates each at a time. The tasting menu is all you can eat. The portions are small so you can try a lot.   The presentation was good, the service was good. The restaurant was almost empty.   As I said, I really wanted to love it, it just wasn't good. I can't recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean fried chicken lettuce wraps
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted Meatballs

Y4xhqIFfn3MKOoicPOX9ig.text: So tonight's got was  just terrible, I love this place as you guys know, but the creamer was a month old and curdled, we ordered the edamame twice and both times it came out slimy both orders did not try for 3rd time, apparently per the internet slimy edamame is bad edamame. Service by Kaitlyn and Bar by Amber and David is always on point, wife was not pleased you took away her sauvignon blanc from New Zealand. So the last couple of times we have been in has been issue filled, but I will refuse to go below 3 for the moment but attention to detail has dropped off.  I honestly like this place very much. The food and drink has just been off the last 3 or 4 visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yes!
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States

N45SlzLqsjAJJgnZev0jHg.text: I came here for a work dinner so we had a set menu. The service was very good and it's a nice space.   We ordered some east and west coast oysters- very good!  The other apps we had were ok-- crab cakes, kimchi cucumbers, and Korean fried lettuce wraps.  The Bibb salad was disappointing--no flavor.   The sirloin with leek and potato puree was good. I wish the scoop of puree was bigger!  The lemon mousse torte lacked the lemony brightness I was expecting but was plated nicely.   I had a bite of the chocolate rum cheesecake and liked it better than the lemon dessert.   There is free valet parking or a big parking lot sort of behind the restaurant.

KW0iNFBNG8Wl9vKYLZnp5Q.text: I had one of my best dining experiences in Charlotte at Upstream.... the food was great. The atmosphere was inviting. Not to mention the wait staff was second to none. As you can see I throughly enjoyed myself. I had the Pecan crusted trout which was great. The Sushi was delicious and Creme Brulee was perfect. Gotta go again.

H8_kpBTsHVVLwSoELSoOHA.text: My friends took me here for my early bday celebration. I love the atmosphere & food was great. I came back twice for brunch. The first time was excellent and however my second visit after a year or so. They change their brunch menu. No more buffet style...we order basically on the menu and each person allow to order 2 items on the menu to share. Less food to waste I guess.

ZG-pCTevk1bHsg9HkDy7DQ.text: My wife an I stopped in for drinks before our movie. It was early afternoon so we had the place basically to ourselves. I played it say and ordered an IPA and my wife ordered a mimosa. I went to the bathroom and when I returned, my wife had the we are leaving right after this.  She explained to me that the bartender poured her already mixed mimosa out of a plastic Tupperware. Was I surprised? A little. We were the only two at the bar. Where's the harm in popping a bottle and pouring a fresh drink? But it would seem it was easier to give us what was left from brunch.  Needless to say we won't bother returning. Small details can make or break your outing.

F8SEZUD0f8pQ0LWiwKQPUA.text: Went for lunch for the half price sushi rolls. They were all pretty good. The ones that apply all have a fish next to them. My only problem was our first experience wasn't so hot. When we came in it was quiet and we didn't see anyone at the host stand. We waited around until finally the owner sat us. Our waiter was the bartender and he was really nice but they apparently had two big parties and he had to do that and bartend as well. I don't know if they were understaffed but the service was unfortunately slow and we felt very neglected. It wasn't his fault.  One of our rolls didn't state it had wasabi on it and we were told that the chef didn't usually do that. We didn't get to order much for waiting 2 hours for service and our food to come out. Our last roll also still had some Saran Wrap on it from when they rolled it.  The owner was pretty nice though and understanding when we told him about our experience and apologized.  I'm hoping to come back and give this place another try despite all the negative reviews on the service and wait and despite our experience. Because it was a nice restaurant and the food wasn't bad at all it was just not the right day.

qBL7-Hge9YCeIKIR_0S4OA.text: I came here to visit a friend for the weekend. We wanted a brunch spot to eat at so we came here. It was completely dead due to the panthers game, so we were seated immediately in the dining room. The website was confusing about the time the brunch ended. We weren't sure if it was over at 2 or 3. I think on Saturdays it is over later than Sunday.   We came there when brunch was ending and they still let us take advantage of brunch. This is what made us drive to this particular restaurant. They had an unlimited brunch tasting menu for $26 with $3 mimosas. They had your typical brunch items and some interesting additions. It ranged from sushi to the roast of the day. The items are small like tapas and they let you order two things at a time.   Because the restaurant was empty we got our items pretty quickly. I ate most of the items on the menu except for the ones that had pork in them, and things I did not want to experiment with like quail eggs.   My favorite was:  avocado salmon toast- had a great mixture of avocado and salmon with a nice flavor.   kabocha pancake- was pretty sweet and flavorful. It is a Japanese style pancake and It reminded me of a sweet potato pancake.   Curried deviled eggs- looked like regular deviled egg but you can def taste the seasoning.   The mini burger- It was a nice size and flavor  Everything on the menu is worth trying and I challenge you to try the whole menu without getting full! The price is great as well even with two mimosas!

Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit and gravy
Photo of Upstream - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curried deviled eggs

Mg_GEZEqRrywmEU3OT4AsQ.text: This was a random dinner pick during a business trip and we lucked out!!   Sea-themed interior, but in a tasteful, sophisticated way - not kitschy at all. Dimly lit with tons of ambiance. I almost wished I wasn't with a co-worker!   Service was impeccable. When our food arrived, I wasn't allow to touch it until my coworker could take a proper picture - beautiful plating! To this day, I've never had better salmon or pearl pasta and that can only be attributed to a chef who is a True artist.   This restaurant is a must whenever I'm in Charlotte!

2fmcCZWx1wpXXXNyhO76LA.text: Really liked this place! The service was amazing and food was pretty good! Our waiter was awesome. There was a chef that came around with small dishes made from local products. I thought this was a unique concept. It allowed us the opportunity to ask specific questions about the menu. He was awesome as well. The watermelon and cantaloupe dish was tasty. I ordered the Bronzino with a glass of wine. The Bronzino was good but nothing to rave about. I give the restaurant a 4 only because the quality of the food didn't reflect the menu prices are a

WndtlZCgZCWnrPsWjyTV3A.text: Sad to say I didn't enjoy my experience at Upstream   I attended for Restaurant Week and found it it be overrated.   When we walked in, the hostess was very unfriendly and had a bit of an attitude. We had a group of 11 (which we made the reservation on Opentable without any issue) and she acted like we were an inconvenience.   The food was average. Interesting crab croquets appetizer. It was my first time ever trying this dish so I have nothing to compare it to. The breading in the outside was good and the inside was almost soup.   The salmon was served with caviar on top (which I don't believe is mentioned on the menu). The piece I got was thin and unimpressive. No real flavor. Very average. It came with a small dollup of mashed cauliflower.   Our server forgot to serve me Brussels sprouts that I had ordered. It took about 8 minutes to get those out. I was shocked that she still charged me for her mistake.   Dessert was sooooo unimpressive. Chocolate cake was half a centimeter thick. Oreo was nonexistent.   Can't say I'll be back.
